NIGHT GUARD, NECK BRACE, DUCT TAPE, A MARS BAR, RUBBING

THIS IS MY REPUTATION. THIS IS MY
MOTHER TALK TO ME THAT WAY YOU'RE

dialogues.speaker: WHITE WINDOWLESS ROOM
dialogues.text: The voice belongs to DR. HARRY MCGURK. In CLOSE UP, he st into the camera, now repeating a DIFFERENT SYLLABLE.

dialogues.speaker: MCGURK
dialogues.text: ---Fa... Fa... Fa... Fa... Fa... Offscreen, a FRIENDLY VOICE addresses the audience.

dialogues.speaker: FRIENDLY VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Close your eyes. (beat) Close them.

dialogues.speaker: FRIENDLY VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You hear “Da”. Now open them.

dialogues.speaker: FRIENDLY VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You hear “Fa”. Close your eyes, it’s “Da”. Open them, it’s “Fa”. Weird, isn’t it? (NOTE: This is a real neurological illusion. The McGurk Effect. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=G-1N8vWm3m0 )

dialogues.speaker: FRIENDLY VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Let’s try it a different way. The SCREEN SPLITS into identical shots of Dr. McGurk. On LEFT, his mouth forms the word “Da”, on the RIGHT, “Fa”.

dialogues.speaker: FRIENDLY VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Pick a side. I won’t tell you which one. Is he saying Fa or Da? (then) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now look at the other side. What’s he saying now? (NOTE: Whoever looks left will hear ‘Da’ and whoever look right will hear ‘Fa’)

dialogues.speaker: FRIENDLY VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The truth is that the sound hasn’t changed- only the picture. All we're hearing is ‘Da Da Da.’ But when you look to the right, his mouth forms the word ‘Fa.’ And your poor brain, having seen lips form this sound for your entire life is powerless. It tells you to hear ‘fa.’ It discounts reality and gives you what it perceives to be true. (then) So what's the point of all this you ask? It’s this- Reality is not what you see. It’s what you think you see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AN UPTOWN WOMAN in her late thirties lingers at the windo Liking what she sees, she waves to the MERCHANT inside. H BUZZES her in.

dialogues.speaker: MERCHANT
dialogues.text: Good afternoon...

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Hi. I love that necklace...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Woman holds up a DIAMOND AND JADE NECKLACE, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Oh this one’s great too.

dialogues.speaker: MERCHANT
dialogues.text: Pure Jade. Mid-century, untreated... She puts it on a VELVET TRAY with SEVERAL OTHER ITEMS, tu her attention to the DISPLAY CASE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about that one...?

dialogues.speaker: MERCHANT
dialogues.text: The sautoir? Wonderful... He opens the case and retrieves a SAUTOIR NECKLACE.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Ohh... A light KNOCK at the door and the Merchant BUZZES another CUSTOMER in. The woman holds the sautoir to her neck.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now this is beautiful. What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Merchant can’t help but notice how beautifully the necklace drapes upon her cleavage.

dialogues.speaker: MERCHANT
dialogues.text: Perfect.

dialogues.speaker: FRIENDLY VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I prefer the one in your coat, Janice. The familiar voice belongs to NICKY SPURGEON (33), dresse a cheap suit worn by undercover cops and rental car agent He sidles up alongside her as his PARTNER- a larger, similarly dressed man- flanks Janice on her other side.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: (busted) Oh fuck--

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Sorry sir, this woman’s been working the area for about a week. The partner starts REMOVING JEWELRY FROM THE WOMAN’S POCK and putting it on the glass counter. The Merchant is shoc

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look familiar? Yeah- (to Partner) Take her. The partner whisks her off. Nicky grabs the Jade necklace from the velvet tray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're an expert- is this real? The Merchant is surprised at what he sees.

dialogues.speaker: MERCHANT
dialogues.text: That’s not mine.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: No. This one is. Nicky picks up the real Jade necklace fished from the wom pocket. He takes command of the room with an authoritativ confident tone.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s her scam-- while she’s holding this here, she’s got your focus. More pointedly- her breasts do. Meanwhile, down here, she’s taking a fake out of her pocket and leaving it on the velvet. She asks to see another- and she pockets the real one. The Merchant is aghast.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Even I can tell this is from the Dollar Bin at Target. But all she needs is a sparkly hint of green in your peripheral vision until she’s out the door. TWO MORE PLAINCLOTHES MEN enter with haste. One begins SNAPPING PHOTOS while Nicky looks to the other.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Pat- we've got cameras here, here, here and here. (to Merchant) We're going to need the surveillance drives. Can someone help him with that? Addled, the merchant looks to a SALESWOMAN across the sto

dialogues.speaker: MERCHANT
dialogues.text: Yes. Anna? He gestures to her and she escorts Pat into the back. Nic keeps up the intensity on the merchant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now look at me. (he does) Do I have your attention? (he does) Is this everything she touched? I need you to be absolutely sure. He nods compliantly.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Everything?

dialogues.speaker: MERCHANT
dialogues.text: Everything. Nicky places a pile of EMPTY EVIDENCE BAGS on the counter

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I need you to place any items she touched into these bags. (he complies) One bag per item. Each bag has a number and each of those numbers are on this claim form. Are you paying attention? He SLAPS A SET OF FORMS on the counter.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is your record. Please make sure the numbers are correct. You will receive two copies- one yellow- one blue. The blue copy-- The man is checking the numbers intently.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you paying attention? (nod) The blue copy is your primary copy. I suggest you put it somewhere other than the yellow copy. But only the blue copy can be used to reclaim evidence. Are you paying attention?

dialogues.speaker: MERCHANT
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Are the numbers correct?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I thought you were paying attention.

dialogues.speaker: MERCHANT
dialogues.text: They seem fine, um, yes. He THRUSTS A PEN in the Merchant’s face.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Good. I need you to sign here. Initial here. Here and here. Initial once more. He TEARS OFF a blue copy and SLAPS it on the counter.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do not lose it. He tears off the yellow copy as Pat re-emerges from the b with a four hard drives in an evidence bag.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now my partner is coming back to take a statement. It might be helpful if you jot a few things down while your memory’s still fresh. Can you do that? He nods as Nicky gathers up the evidence bags of jewelry.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you have any questions, this is my card, okay?

dialogues.speaker: MERCHANT
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: We’re gonna get this done as soon as possible. Promise. (holds out his hand) Pen.

dialogues.speaker: MERCHANT
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: You stole my pen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! Sorry. The Merchant finds Nicky’s pen in his pocket, hands it ba

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Thank you. Nicky heads for the door. The Merchant watches, concerned

dialogues.speaker: MERCHANT
dialogues.text: Blue copy, right?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: (smiles) You were paying attention. Very good. And with a wide smile, Nicky’s gone. The Merchant looks to the business card. It’s BLANK. He turns it over. BLANK. Confused, he picks up the blue form. What he sees concern him: A SMILING CARPET LOGO above a company name- “MISTER STEAMY CARPET CLEANING.” He looks up. The store is EMPTY- every DISPLAY CASE has been cleaned o Anna emerges from the back, not yet aware...

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: That policeman gave me a blank card. Isn’t that funny? And as the Merchant bolts for the door--

dialogues.speaker: SMASH CUT TO
dialogues.text: TITLE CARD: “FOCUS”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High above the city in the cool blue gloam of twilight, N takes in the view from the BALCONY. He seems as distant a the lights on the horizon, as he nibbles on a small packa of gummy bears. He CRUMPLES the empty bag and returns to his room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicky waits for the elevator. He notices a MOTHER and her SON approaching from down the hall. He watches them. DING! The doors open. Nicky enters the elevator, presses lobby button. The mother rushes for the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Coming... Nicky pays no mind and doesn’t register the woman's astonished face as the doors SHUT on her just inches away

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Really?! No reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicky approaches a comely CONCIERGE. He turns on the char

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Hi, how are you tonight?

dialogues.speaker: CONCIERGE
dialogues.text: I'm fine, thanks- how can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Weren’t you working this morning? You must be exhausted. I hope they’re paying you enough.

dialogues.speaker: CONCIERGE
dialogues.text: Well, no, but thank you for noticing.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I know Elegio is reservation only, but do they still accept walk-ins at the bar?

dialogues.speaker: CONCIERGE
dialogues.text: Yes, but at eight it may not be worth your time...

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: That’s why I wanted to talk to you. (smile) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you call them and tell them Chef Julien Bardolejo of Las Losos in Barcelona was hoping they’d save a spot for him at the bar?

dialogues.speaker: CONCIERGE
dialogues.text: (smiles knowingly) I suppose I could give it shot.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: You have a wonderful night. He finishes with a wide smile that satisfies her. It quic fades as he heads for the door- passing a group of TOURIS posing for a photo. One of them EXTENDS A CAMERA to him.

dialogues.speaker: TOURIST
dialogues.text: Would you mind...? He keeps walking, pretending not to hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A high end hotel restaurant with a crowded bar- Nicky sea prominently at the head of it, enjoying a glass of wine a WAITER places a PLATE of finely prepared food before him.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Gracias, sefor. He cuts into his food, takes a bite. ON THE KITCHEN DOOR: A CHEF and SOUS CHEF sneak looks at awaiting a reaction to their food. Nicky reaches for the SALT. The chef is crushed.

dialogues.speaker: CHEF
dialogues.text: Dammit... The sous chef tries to console him as he skulks off. BACK ON NICKY: Looking around the bar, taking in the face the strangers. Eventually, at the far end of the bar-- A beautiful young woman (JESS BARRETT) shoos off the adva of a DRUNKEN STRANGER. We can’t hear, but reading her lip

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: I'm waiting for someone. He'll be here any minute...  10. Nicky watches the drunk lean in close to her. She looks around trying to ignore the clingy suitor, making brief e contact with Nicky. She SMIRKS at him as she gently PUSHE the drunk away with a laugh. Nicky smiles and returns to his food. He salts it again.

dialogues.speaker: CHEF, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (distant, from kitchen)

dialogues.speaker: FUCK
dialogues.text: This amuses Nicky, until-

dialogues.speaker: JESS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Are you a serial killer? CUT WIDE to reveal JESS is standing next to him.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: No. Not anymore, at least. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Can you be my boyfriend for a minute?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Sure. Waiting for someone?

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Not really. No.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Join me for dinner?

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Love to. He turns to the bartender to order when she suddenly grab his plate and starts eating.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I was going to-- (then) Never mind. (to Bartender) Uno mas por favor.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: This is really good.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: It is.  11.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Kinda salty though.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Didn’t notice...

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: I'm Jess.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Nicky. They share a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Near closing time. The crowd has thinned. Jess and Nicky still at the bar, surrounded by half-empty wine glasses a mostly eaten dessert, clearly enjoying themselves.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: What was this one again?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Montrachet.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Montrachet. And this one?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Gevrey Chambertin. Same region, different grape.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Burgundy.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Very good.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Yaaaaay... A mini high five as Jess beams. Even to a guarded man lik Nicky, she’s disarming and sexy without trying.

dialogues.speaker: JESS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So confusing. How’d you learn all this?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Mostly by drinking. The more you drink the more you learn...  12.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Well then that makes me the foremost expert on Jaeger Bombs. They laugh. The bartender gently places the BILL before Nicky. The couple mourns it’s arrival.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: For the wine. Food is compliments of the Chef. Nicky nods politely and pulls out a huge roll of hundreds

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Does this mean it’s over? I still have so much to learn.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I’m afraid so.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Sad. Well thanks for the rescue...

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: No problem, although I think your nemesis has lost his sting. He motions across the bar where the drunk guy has nodded with his head in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can I walk you somewhere?

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: (pointing upstairs) Actually I’m staying here.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Oh...

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: So, yes. A look. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicky and Jess kiss passionately as they back up to the b landing on it with her atop him. After a deep, deep kiss Jess sits up with a smoldering lo She starts to remove her top when--  13. SLAM! The door WHIPS OPEN to reveal a HUGE MAN with a GUN

dialogues.speaker: HUGE MAN
dialogues.text: I knew you were here, bitch! Jess flies off of Nicky who sits up quickly.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: It’s my husband!

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: You're married!?

dialogues.speaker: HUGE MAN
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up!

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Jared wait! Jared rushes toward Nicky and SLAM! PINS HIM AGAINST THE HEADBOARD-- holding the gun to his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: I’m gonna fucking kill you!

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: NO Jared! Let him go!

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: No fucking way! You’re dead. (gets in his face) Give me one fucking reason I shouldn't do it?! Nicky, strangely calm, thinks a moment.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I'm drawing a blank...

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I think you should do it. I mean let's be honest. You’ve been aggrieved. Jared and Jess are stymied.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Don’t mess around with him Nicky- he’s done hard time!  14.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: (to Jared) And frankly, if you had any idea what I was planning to do to your wife before you came in, you’d be really aggrieved.

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: Shut up man!

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Dirty stuff. Really dirty stuff. Real Apehouse stuff.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Wait a second- what kind of stuff are we talking about?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Tommy Lee kind of stuff. You should definitely shoot.

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: Stop fucking around! I’1l do it!

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: You'd be doing me a huge favor. Seriously- I’ve got a brain tumor the size of a softball. Jared is surprised to hear this.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please...

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: (conflicted) Ah shit! You got cancer? He backs away as Jess goes is suddenly defeated.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: He’s onto to us. Are you a pro?

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: Shit. I told you this wasn’t going to work.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Just give us the money.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Or what?  15.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Or he’s gonna shoot you in the neck.

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: I don’t want to shoot a guy with cancer. Grandma Mikulski had cancer...

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: He doesn’t have cancer you idiot! (to Nicky) Just give us the money.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: You guys really boned this. You’re supposed to wait until she gets my pants off so when you come in I leave them behind when you tell me to run. Then you got the cash and I’m never coming back. Second- whatever you heard- about how it’s not a felony if there’s no bullets in the gun? It’s crap. Deadly weapon, loaded or not. Jared and Jess completely drop their guard.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: When did you make us?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: When you lifted the drunk guy’s wallet.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: What? Bullshit. Nicky reaches into her jacket on the bed, pulls out a man wallet and tosses it to her.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Couldn’t have been more obvious... She catches it, Nicky heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: It was good lift!

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Sure it was... Nicky is gone, turns her frustration on Jared.  16.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Why didn’t you wait!?

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: How was I supposed to know when you had his pants off!?

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: How many times did we go over this? I say, “that’s the biggest one I’ve ever seen” and then you come through the door.

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: I did hear it! But now I’m thinking it came from across the hall. What are the chances!?

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: I should have never asked you to do this!

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: Are you mad at me?

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: Can I still be your trainer? Jess cools slightly.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: (deep exhale) Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: Are you still gonna come to my Zamba class?

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: ...Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicky makes his way through the chilly night back to his hotel. He’s seems pretty unfazed by the goings on.

dialogues.speaker: JESS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: That was not a shitty lift! He stops, turns- Jess a few yards behind him and approach  17.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: The drummer from Def Leopard could take the poke off a drunk. You think that makes you special?

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: No. This does. She pulls out a DIFFERENT WALLET. Nicky pauses. He pats h breast pocket, it’s his. He’s impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A romantic open air CAFE atop THE HIGH LINE. Nicky and Je have coffee at a cozy table. Nicky is mid story.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: ..-my Grandfather used to pay Union Pacific twenty grand a year to let him run a game on their trains. Not to the conductor- the owner himself. Cash in hand. Never had a problem, until one day the game got held up by a team out of Toledo. But one of the players had a little derringer- thinks its a good time to defend himself- whips it out- misses. Other guys start firing. Grandpa catches a bullet in the eye. Shouldn’t have happened. (then) Know who knocked over the game? My dad.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: No. Did he know?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Of course. He raised my dad in it just like my dad raised me in it. You see an angle- you play it. He didn’t mean for it to go down that way- thought he’d impress him later by splitting up the money with him. At least that’s what I was raised to believe. (then) He was only eighteen years old...

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Jesus.  18.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: You do this long enough, you see everyone as a player or as someone to be played. It’s no life.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: What’s your thing? Inside? Roper?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Everything- been in it so long. Short grift, Big Store. Work the whiz all over too. Cannon...

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: That’s what I want to do.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: No you don’t.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: I want to learn it all. I want you to show me.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Look-

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: No- I wasn’t born into this like you. I was a dyslexic foster kid- no prospects, no future. It’s a minor miracle I’m not a hooker right now. I was lucky enough to have a boyfriend to show me how to lift and I’ve done okay. I know I have a lot to learn but its not like mentors are falling off trees. You’re my shot.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: You want advice? Here- Stay off the grift and stay away from the whiz mobs. Because once you're in, you're in. Stick to the pockets, work alone. Save your money and one day you get out and start a business or something. Maybe you fall in love or just have a life.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: I can pay you. Just teach me.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I don’t do that.  19. A WAITER leans in and places the CHECK between them. Nick reaches for it, Jess stops him.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: I got this. The waiter EXITS, revealing Jess has PULLED THE WALLET FR THE WAITER’S POCKET WITH HER OTHER HAND.

dialogues.speaker: JESS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m good. You know I’m good. She pulls out some cash. Nicky smiles.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Not the point. Besides- I’m leaving town tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Detroit.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Now you're being a dick. No one goes to Detroit.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: None of your business.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: At least teach me something.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Just one thing? Can you show me just one thing? Something new I could use? Anything? Pleeease? (off Nicky’s look) I bought you coffee... Nicky SIGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicky demonstrates for Jess. His COAT hangs on a sign and uses his wallet in the front lapel pocket as an example.  20.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I’1ll teach you how to do a few touches but that’s it. I’1l assume you can flip a leather on it’s feet, throw it over if you need to- and pull... Quickly and smoothly he positions the wallet without movi the coat and eventually pulls it out. Something to see. H tosses it in another pocket.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Breast pocket is harder but we know you've got that down- at least if the guy’s had 6 MacCallans...

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Ha ha...

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Sneaky is fine, but you can get away with much more when you have their attention. He turns to her, taking control.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look him in the eye. Shake his hand maybe- He gives her a shake. Once he lets go, he raises his othe hand to show her a PAIR OF GLASSES.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did you feel that?

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: (smirk) No.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: How about this? He holds up her WATCH. She’s shocked.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: You took that right off my wrist!

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: It’s about distraction. It’s about focus. The brain is slow and it can’t multitask. You touch him here- do what you want here-  21. Nicky holds up a MEMBERSHIP CARD.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You take Zumba?

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: That’s not mine. He continues with incredible agility and speed.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Tap him here, take from here. Look over there, he follows. Take from here... He’s showing her things from her pockets without her even realizing his other hand is pulling out OTHER THINGS. It’ slick, flirtatious ballet and she’s in the middle of it.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s on your head? Her GLASSES are now on her head. She smirks. How could sh not feel that?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you gonna slap me?

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: If you knew where my hand was you'd want to. She looks down, but it’s too late- he’s already pulled he iPhone out of her back pocket. The show continues, becoming ever more seductive, until s can’t take it anymore.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Okay okay okay... I get it. Nicky takes a moment. He steps in close, stares in her ey He gently raises her hand into frame... ...and PLACES HER OWN RING BACK ON HER FINGER. She’s wett than a submarine with screen doors.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Now you've got something to practice...  22. He walks away, leaving her gobsmacked on the green expans the 23rd Street Lawn. FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicky and an older man, HORST, wander through a well worn empty house- peeking in room after room in relative silen

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Why do I like this place?

dialogues.speaker: HORST
dialogues.text: No neighbors for one. Foreclosures all around it. I tied ‘em all up with offers just in case somebody decides to buy a house down here again. (Nicky nods) Follow me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PALM TREES and SUN tell us we’re not in New York anymore. Nicky and Horst emerge from the pastel 1920's bungalow to large yard with and empty pool and look at a UTILITY POLE

dialogues.speaker: HORST
dialogues.text: Sub-junction. We can tie in to multiple lines so we can diffuse our footprint and keep hopping DNS addresses. FIOS too... Nicky nods again.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: How many bathrooms? Fat Ass Farhad is flying in so--

dialogues.speaker: HORST
dialogues.text: Two and a half. He still got IBS?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: HORST
dialogues.text: He should do a cleanse.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: He’s a 500 pound Persian, Horst- he’s not gonna do a cleanse. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Give him the half-bath. I don’t want to hear it from Manny and Bob.

dialogues.speaker: HORST
dialogues.text: We'll be up and running by morning. Where you been staying? Hyatt again?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I like the brunch. You should come by.

dialogues.speaker: HORST
dialogues.text: No brunch. I’m doing a cleanse. Nicky tunes him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Various shots of Nicky driving Miami causeways and street EXT. DOG TRACK —- HOLLYWOOD FLORIDA - SUNSET GREYHOUNDS lit by late afternoon sun run the track as the crowd CHEERS. IN THE STANDS, Nicky takes in the last race with a beer. table before him is littered with CRUMPLED RACE TICKETS. somber face denotes concern. And as the ANNOUNCER calls the end of the race, Nicky CRUMPLES up yet another ticket and sighs. INT. MIAMI BEACH HYATT HOTEL —- DAY A crowded dining area by the pool, populated by FOOTBALL FANS. Alone at a table, Nicky reads a PAPER and sips COFF

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Will you be ordering from the menu this morning or using the buffet?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: (not looking up) Buffet.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I think you’1l find the pancakes are the best in all of Detroit. He looks up. It’s Jess, proud of herself.  24.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Impressive.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: May I? He nods and she sits.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Hyatt rewards card in my wallet?

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: But why Miami?

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: It’s Super Bowl week. It’s sucker central. Even I know that. They take in the surrounding PATRONS, dressed in football jerseys and drinking heavily.

dialogues.speaker: JESS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mardi Gras for every lifter and grifter in North America.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: How many Hyatts did you try?

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: All seven... three times each.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Sounds boring.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Not so bad. Gave me time to practice. She turns over her purse- 24 WATCHES pour out onto the ta

dialogues.speaker: JESS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thanks for showing me that. (then) Now I want in.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Maybe I’m just here to see the game.  He smiles. 25.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Everyone knows who ran the game on the Union Pacific. You're Nicky Spurgeon. Your grandfather was The Limehouse Kid. Your father is Bucky Spurgeon who’s like the best insideman that’s ever been. I know you're doing something big down here. I just want in.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I’m all crewed up.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Oh come on. (he shrugs) Look- Can we skip the part where I speak with thinly veiled allure? Where I lead you to believe there’s gonna be some earth shattering hump in the works? Please spare me that because I suck at that kind of stuff. I just want in.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: No thinly veiled allure?

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: No baby voice? No lingering eye contact? No lippy mouthing of your straw?

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: I’m hopeless.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: A hand grazing my knee?

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: But I love that stuff.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Sorry.  26.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: You really should learn. It’s a useful tool, professionally. She purses her lips and cocks her shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: (baby voice) Well maybe you can teach me... in your room... She sips from Nicky’s orange juice straw. He is appalled.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Oh my God... that’s terrible.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: I know! See?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: We should go. Nicky gets up. Jess is excited.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Am I in?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: We should go. She follows him, beaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA MOVES THROUGH a bar packed with fans of the opposi teams as they drink and revel.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Every minute there’s something going on down here. Every bar, restaurant, hotel, wherever... SHOT CONTINUES as a BEARDED MAN bumps into a FAN, quickly apologizing. TILT DOWN as HE TAKES THE FAN’S WALLET.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Guys working alone, working in teams. Not just cash either. Identity theft is a big thing too.  27. ON THE WALLET as the thief PULLS OUT a CREDIT CARD and HA IT ANOTHER THIEF who SWIPES it on a HANDHELD CARD READER.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You can skim the data off a credit card in about a second... The credit card is returned to the wallet, passed off aga and within seconds-- the WALLET IS BACK IN THE FAN’S BACK POCKET and he is none the wiser.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: .--and by the time the mark gets wise, he’s back in Youngstown arguing with his wife over the card statement. SHOT CONTINUES to REVEAL NICKY AND JESS at the bar- surrounded by a GANG of ROWDY GUYS. Nicky is mid-bet with one of them, a BALD GUY. Nicky refers to two SHOT GLASSES before him. ONE filled t the brim with BOURBON, the other with WATER.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I’1l make the bourbon and the water switch glasses without pouring them into anything, including my mouth-

dialogues.speaker: BALD GUY
dialogues.text: No way. But hell- Fifty bucks? Why the fuck not? The other men start waving money around, wanting a piece the action. Jess COLLECTS it as: Nicky grabs a COASTER, PUTS IT ON THE WATER FILLED SHOT G turns it UPSIDE DOWN and puts it ON THE BOURBON GLASS. He PULLS THE COASTER OUT SLIGHTLY to open up a little spa between the glasses and they all watch as PHYSICS TAKES O

dialogues.speaker: THE HEAVIER WATER FLOWS DOWN INTO THE BOURBON GLASS AND T
dialogues.text: LIGHTER BOURBON FLOATS UP INTO THE WATER GLASS. The men explode in delighted disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY GUYS
dialogues.text: OOOH! No way! Awesome! Etc...

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: (checks his watch) It’s been fun guys... Smiling Nicky GRABS THE MONEY and they EXIT.  28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MONTAGE CONTINUES as Jess and Nicky emerge from a cab.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: There’s a flight landing every two minutes at Miami International. Average of 200 passengers per flight. Whoevers not here for the game is here for the party- every one of them looking to drink big, bet big, cheat on their spouse-- and it all costs money... And as they enter the--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A busy lobby. PEOPLE mill about, OTHERS are lined up at t registration desk with their luggage.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: (checking his watch) There’s boost teams at all the major hotels. They hit quick and get out before anyone knows what happened... Nicky suddenly stops short and YELLS at Jess.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: IF YOU THINK I’M GONNA LET YOUR

dialogues.speaker: FUCKING CRAZY
dialogues.text: THE ENTIRE LOBBY TURNS. Jess stands there perplexed and r to hit him. But as Nicky keeps YELLING-- QUICK CUTS all around the LOBBY as THIEVES DISGUISED AS TOURISTS take advantage of the situation with amazing spe BY A GIFT SHOP: A passing thief SWAPS OUT a GUCCI SHOPPIN BAG at the feet of a rich woman, stealing hers. ON THE REGISTRATION LINE: A “GUEST” places a FALSE BOTTOM SUITCASE over someone else’s SMALLER SUITCASE and calmly walks away with it inside. All around, SWAPS AND LIFTS play out within seconds to ot unsuspecting people. BACK TO NICKY and JESS. Nicky is suddenly contrite:  29.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry sweetie, me and my temper... He hugs her. She’s mystified.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: What the hell was that?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Don’t worry about it. They resume their walk across the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Did I miss something...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUE MONTAGE as a group of HUSTLERS and CARD SHARPS h out in a room. It’s a cheater’s gymnasium-- some practice double deals, others shuffle cards with staggering dexter

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: There’s card games everywhere and they let anyone with enough cash in. Chances are at least one of those guys you don’t know is a mechanic who can work a deck like Jascha Heifetz doing Tedesco... A CARD MECHANIC shaves down the side of a card deck with sandpaper. A HUSTLER passes out STACKS OF CASH to the oth

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Guys will shave down the entire deck except for the aces so they can feel them when they shuffle and pull them out when they need them. ANOTHER CARD SHARP puts in a CONTACT LENS.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Some guys use marked cards you can only see with polarized contacts and glasses...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PLAYER across from him holds a FIVE CARD HAND. The valu his cards are CLEARLY MARKED IN RED on the backs.  30.

dialogues.speaker: PLAYER
dialogues.text: Trips... CUT TO REVEAL WE’RE AT-—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HIGH STAKES GAME at a raucous high end party in a penthouse. A huge pile of chips and cash is in play. The Card Sharp is opposite the PLAYER, shaking his head i disbelief as he lays down FOUR OF A KIND.

dialogues.speaker: POKER PLAYERS
dialogues.text: Whoa! Shit! Etc...

dialogues.speaker: CARD SHARP
dialogues.text: I swear, I’ve never had a four of a kind before! The Player as well as TOBEY MAGUIRE and LEBRON JAMES suff huge loss as the “surprised” Card Sharp rakes in the chip MONTAGE CONTINUES as CAMERA DRIFTS from the table to REVE that Nicky and Jess are watching nearby.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Come with me... CAMERA CONTINUES past them, THROUGH THE WALL to reveal--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MARK and BUXOM WOMAN are about to fornicate when- SLAM! The door to the room is kicked open by a BIG BRUISER.

dialogues.speaker: BUXOM WOMAN
dialogues.text: It’s my husband! As they scramble--

dialogues.speaker: BRUISER
dialogues.text: I’m gonna kill you!

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: (to woman) Give me my pants!

dialogues.speaker: BUXOM WOMAN
dialogues.text: No! Just run!  31. CAMERA FOLLOWS the pants-less mark as he dodges the Bruis and runs out the door and into the HALL-- PASSING JESS AN NICKY from the opposite direction. Nicky looks to Jess-- clearly inferring that that is how it’s done.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Married guys are the best- who are they gonna tell? A second woman SCREAMS from ANOTHER ROOM. WOMAN’S VOICE (0.S.) That’s my husband! ANOTHER PANTSLESS MARK bursts out of a different room, running for the elevator as Jess and Nicky round the corn END MONTAGE as we CUT TO-- INT. NICKY’S CAR - NIGHT CLOSE ON NICKY, driving. CLOSE ON JESS next to him. Looki uneasy, she shoots an occasional GLANCE over her shoulder CUT WIDE to reveal FAT ASS FARHAD, the 500 pound Persian is filling up the back seat and scowling at Jess.

dialogues.speaker: FAT ASS FARHAD
dialogues.text: Who's she?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: That’s Jess, Farhad. She’s our intern.

dialogues.speaker: FAT ASS FARHAD
dialogues.text: Oh... A long silence, then--

dialogues.speaker: FAT ASS FARHAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You hittin’ that?

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: (furls her brow) I’m right here.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: FAT ASS FARHAD
dialogues.text: She's feisty.  Beat. 32.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: FAT ASS FARHAD
dialogues.text: You should hit that.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Hello? I’m still right here.

dialogues.speaker: FAT ASS FARHAD
dialogues.text: (pointing ahead) Next block. Take a left.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: FAT ASS FARHAD
dialogues.text: I'd totally hit that.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Is this a hazing thing? Like making a frat boy blow a goat? (then) Now that I say that I guess I shouldn't complain...

dialogues.speaker: FAT ASS FARHAD
dialogues.text: She talks a lot...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BUSINESSMAN gets cash from an ATM machine and exits. A moment later, FARHAD ENTERS FRAME. He quickly REMOVES THE PLASTIC FACE OF THE MACHINE, revea that it is an exact replica of the machine face beneath i Nicky and Jess watch as he walks back to the car with it.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: A skimmer swipes the card and records the keystrokes so you can get the PIN too.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Wow. He made that?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Few years back he replaced the credit card terminals at 78 Starbucks in the Southwest. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (then) Took down a quarter million before they caught on.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: What’s a guy like that do with that kind of money?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Bought his mom a house, got the Lap Band...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicky, Jess and Farhad (holding the ATM facade) enter the bungalow. There’s STOLEN MERCHANDISE everywhere as well a group of GRIFTERS working a small BANK OF PHONES.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: We’re about 30 strong- everyone makes a percentage. We cover bribes and the fall money for anybody who gets pinched, knock wood- KNOCK KNOCK. Everyone else knocks wood along with Nicky.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We sell the ATM data to a guy in Singapore and the shopaholics over there... (referring to phone bank) ..-buy merchandise we overnight to ourselves and resell on the gray market. Yesterday we bought 200 Canon Sure Shots... They pass FAMILIAR FACES from the hotel lobby UNPACKING stolen Louis Vuitton SUITCASES, finding JEWELRY, CASH, PASSPORTS, etc...

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Oh my god... Jess picks up a beautiful DECO STYLE GARNET NECKLACE.

dialogues.speaker: JESS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is so incredible. You think I could-- Nicky grabs it from her.  34.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Nope. We sell everything. Take no chances. She takes it back.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: It could be an advance. Please...

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Advance? Don’t get ahead of yourself. He takes it from her again.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: What about the big con? I thought you were all big time, what’s the big con?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: We’ll get to that. They enter a nearby ROOM. CASH riffles through a counter to JENNY (55) who bundles stacks of bills and puts them i SAFE.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Whoa...

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Jenny- front me five K. I got bit at the track. Jenny has a MOMENT OF PAUSE, then tosses him a banded sta

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Have you seen Horst?

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Smoking. Nicky nods, turns to Jess.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I gotta take care of something. Be right back. She nods and watches as he goes outside, joining Horst on back porch. She turns back toward the living room. Farhad motions for her to join him. She reluctantly approaches.  35.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few of THE CREW stack MERCHANDISE AND MILL ABOUT. Jess Farhad sit at his computer, looking at something.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Awww- who’s that?

dialogues.speaker: FAT ASS FARHAD
dialogues.text: That's my little girl Mina.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Cute.

dialogues.speaker: FAT ASS FARHAD
dialogues.text: (click) My son, Dani.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Sweet.

dialogues.speaker: FAT ASS FARHAD
dialogues.text: (click) That's my wife Lida.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Pretty.

dialogues.speaker: FAT ASS FARHAD
dialogues.text: (click) That’s my dick.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: (ignoring) Uh huh...

dialogues.speaker: FAT ASS FARHAD
dialogues.text: Sorry about that. (click) That’s my dog...

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Awwww. They click through a few more. Then-

dialogues.speaker: JESS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So you’ve known Nicky a long time?

dialogues.speaker: FAT ASS FARHAD
dialogues.text: Yeah. Ten years or so...

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Are you friends?  36.

dialogues.speaker: FAT ASS FARHAD
dialogues.text: Yeah I guess I’m about the closest thing he got to a friend.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: How long have you known him?

dialogues.speaker: FAT ASS FARHAD
dialogues.text: Uh- ten years? Why?

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Just wondering.

dialogues.speaker: FAT ASS FARHAD
dialogues.text: Okay you got me-- we’re sleeping together okay? Like the Ancient Greeks. It’s so beautiful. Jess laughs.

dialogues.speaker: FAT ASS FARHAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Actually, I don’t know. I like the guy. I do. Trust him. But people just aren’t his bag.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: I guess you can’t blame him. I mean he told me about that thing with his dad and his grandfather. Crazy. Farhad is surprised to hear this. A moment, then-

dialogues.speaker: FAT ASS FARHAD
dialogues.text: He told you that? (then) I mean- I’ve heard that story, but- never from him.

dialogues.speaker: HORST, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Jess? Horst is at the threshold.

dialogues.speaker: HORST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you Jess?

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Yes. Hi.

dialogues.speaker: HORST
dialogues.text: Horst. Nice to meet you. Nicky says you're quite a gifted wire.  37.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Never said that to me, but I’11 take the compliment.

dialogues.speaker: HORST
dialogues.text: He’d like to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jess comes out to the dim porch to find Nicky sitting on old patio furniture watching a HORSE RACE on a small TV.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Who you rooting for?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: The wrong horse. He gets up.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Horst runs the whiz. He’s the cannon and the steer. He’s also your boss if you still want in.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Really!? Yes! Yes! Thank you! She bounces and gives him an impulsive hug.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Don’t thank me. You’ve got a busy week coming. He reaches into an envelope, hands her a CREDIT CARD.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here’s a clean card. Jenny will make you a Florida ID.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: (regards card) Ooh, Platinum. You know a good hotel? I don’t know Miami really.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I already got you a place. She's pleasantly surprised.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Really? Is it nice?  38.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Not bad. I think you’1l like it.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Thanks. How do I get there?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Need a car?

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: I don’t really drive. New Yorker...

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Oh... Need a ride?

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Really? Sure... A moment as both of them think about this. A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: JESS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (a little nervous) I mean... If that’s okay with you... He looks at her, thinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ridiculously lush suite. Jess in the powder room in a lightweight robe, looking in the mirror, primping. As we watch Jess, we HEAR THE CONVERSATION from the PREVI

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: I'm fine with it. Are you? She exits the powder room, relishing the luxury of her we appointed suite as she approaches the BEDROOM SUITE...

dialogues.speaker: JESS, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: You seem like a pretty good driver. I’1ll take a chance.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: You can count on me. She slowly pushes through the bedroom door--

dialogues.speaker: JESS, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Can I?  39.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Most would say no.

dialogues.speaker: JESS, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: I don’t know. You seem trustworthy.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: That would be your first mistake.

dialogues.speaker: JESS, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: (laughs) The bedroom is empty. Nicky is not in the room with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Romantic tension is palpable as they look at one another. Nicky seems to second guess his impulses for a moment. Sh picks up on it and lets him off easy.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Maybe I’1l just take a cab. Nicky gives a gentle nod. She walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jess stands out on the BALCONY-- taking in the skyline of Miami much the way Nicky did in New York. Finally, a hard earned break. FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OPEN ON 6 inch stiletto heels, shakily walking. REVEAL JESS- dressed provocatively, squeezed into a tight dress, her bustline boosted by cutlets.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Why do I have to do this Horst? I’m gonna sprain an ankle or I’m gonna sprain a boob- I’m not sure which. CUT WIDER to reveal Jess, Horst, the Bearded Thief from t bar (GARETH) as they walk through a crowded mall.  40.

dialogues.speaker: HORST
dialogues.text: Any man pickpocket would kill to have your figure. No one looks at your hands when you’ve got that working for you.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: I can’t breathe. (adjusting cutlets) It’s like being felt up by The Incredible Hulk.

dialogues.speaker: HORST
dialogues.text: First things first. We stick to rich folks. And no one with a cane or a wheelchair- it’s bad luck. (then) Gareth is the stall. All eyes on me until I make the mark. Once I fan him- I’1l tug my lapel. Two fingers means the it’s a prat poke, three fingers means the leather is an insider. If it’s a cordeen or an ox tongue I scratch my nose-- unless I use my thumb which means I’m actually scrathing my nose. Anything in the left tail or right tail I’1l cock my head but nowadays kiester kicks are 95 percent of it so just do the touch and I ding the poke in the nearest mailbox, okay?

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: (out of her depth) Oh my God- what did you just say?

dialogues.speaker: HORST
dialogues.text: (sigh) Okay, plan B--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC as Nicky pulls into a parking garage, eventually snagging a spot on Tangerine level. INT. MALL — DAY MUSIC CONTINUES as Nicky walks through the mall along the UPPER LEVEL SHOPS. He comes to a RAILING, looking down to the LEVEL BELOW.  41. Nicky sees Jess admiring a dress in a shop window. Nearby, Horst is eyeing the crowd while perusing his cellphone. He SNAPS a photo. ON JESS-- she receives a TEXTED PHOTO OF A RICH WOMAN ON PHONE. She spots the woman in the oncoming crowd. And as RICH WOMAN passes behind her, Jess FOLLOWS. Nicky watches with great interest, starts WALKING, keepin pace with the action below. NICKY POV: Jess GAINS on the woman, drawing closer until- Gareth ‘accidentally’ BUMPS THE WOMAN’S LEFT SHOULDER as passes from the other direction. At the same time-- -- JESS PASSES HER ON THE RIGHT, effortlessly DIPS HER HA INTO THE WOMAN’S PRADA BAG and pulls out a leather WALLET It’s over before the woman even turns to apologize to Gar Nicky is intrigued. She’s a natural. He keeps her in his sights as she moves. Whatever she’s doing, it’s not over. NICKY POV: Jess “bumps into” a group of young men, sudden taking on the body language of an apologetic, klutzy girl Nicky watches as she uses this as a chance to FAN THE MEN CLOTHING as they try to put the ‘klutzy’ Jess at ease. They look to be GIVING HER DIRECTIONS, unaware as Jess DI into one pocket, then ANOTHER. ON NICKY: Smirking as she shakes a guy’s hand and TAKES H WATCH like Nicky showed her. She’s graceful and deft. Nicky tries to keep her in his view as she moves on and passes Horst. Imperceptibly, she DUMPS THE GOODS WITH HIM KEEPS GOING. This ballet continues, as does Nicky’s fascination with h She's making it look easy but it’s anything but that. He’ never seen anything like her before... he’s enamoured. Maybe more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POP! Champagne corks fly as the team celebrates.  42. Horst, Farhad, Jess are amidst the crowd of crooks, helpi Nicky pour out champagne from a few magnum bottles.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: A record setting week, everybody. As of three this morning- One point two million. Cheers from the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t forget to take your personal belongings tonight- because by the time the big game is over this place will be bleached down and repainted and everything not bolted down is going in the incinerator. (then) Horst has your travel money. Once you're home, I’1l wire you all your cut. Congratulations! More cheers as they clink plastic glasses-- Farhad takes a swig and raises his glass

dialogues.speaker: FAT ASS FARHAD
dialogues.text: once again to Jess. To the Rookie of the Year. Sorry if I was a dick...

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Wouldn't have it any other way Farhad... you make me smile.

dialogues.speaker: FAT ASS FARHAD
dialogues.text: You're a cool chick Jess. I dig your shit.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Thank you. They clink glasses. LATER THAT NIGHT, Jess mills through the pleasantries with her new acquaintances. She spots Nicky at the edge of the yard, She heads over.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: party, exchanges talking with Horst.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: ACROSS THE YARD, Horst hands Nicky a BLACK DUFFLE BAG.  43.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: That all of it? One point two?

dialogues.speaker: HORST
dialogues.text: (concerned) Yeah. No ponies or dogs right?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: How long have you known me?

dialogues.speaker: HORST
dialogues.text: That’s my point. See you when I see you. They exchange smiles. Horst EXITS, revealing a nearby Jes who overheard everything. Nicky is pleased to see her.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: There she is- I wanted to ask you something...

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Yeah me too. No big cons? I thought you were all big time.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: No big cons. It’s a volume business. Not sexy, I know- but it’s profitable, it’s safe and it works. Hell, we may even offer health care next year.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Kind of a gyp. Nicky smiles at her forwardness.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Maybe on the next one, George Raft. But I just made you fifty K- where’s the gratitude?

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: I’m an ingrate, I admit it. But I’m ambitious - most people find it charming.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Very charming. But if I could steer the conversation back to my opening line. You feel like going to the game tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Super Bowl? Really? Like, just us? Nicky offers an affirmative shrug.

dialogues.speaker: JESS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yeah. That’d be great.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Good. Meet you there.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: (sincere) But, um, seriously- I want to thank you for bringing me in on this. Thanks for trusting me. She extends her hand. He shakes.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: No offense, but I never trusted you.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: None taken. I assume you feel that way about everybody.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I had a dog once, but yeah.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Poor wounded bird lining his nest with hundred dollar bills...

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: It’s a sob story, I admit it. I feel sorry for myself.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Genius must be such a burden.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Crushing. Jess smiles. Nicky too. A long pause. A kiss moment? Agai Nicky squelches it coolly.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: So, I’ll see you tomorrow. She walks off, Nicky reaches into his breast pocket.  45.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Wait- I forgot to give you your ticket...

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: No you didn’t. She waves a SUPER BOWL TICKET over her shoulder as she ex and he puts two and two together. He smirks, loving it, dwelling on her exit. PRELAP MUSIC as we CUT TO--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER BOWL. The air is electric, fans pour into the stadi At the turnstiles, Jess shows her ticket as she comes through. A TICKET TAKER points her toward her destination

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Jess rises to the top of an ESCALATOR- checking her ticke and looking for a sign to guide her.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: ON AN UPPER LEVEL, a confused Jess approaches an USHER. H leads her to a set of FROSTED GLASS DOORS which SLIDE OPE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The din of the crowd is muffled within the enclosed hallw Eventually her ticket leads her to a door marked “SKY BOX She checks her ticket to be sure, then OPENS THE DOOR to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ROAR of the crowd fills her ears as she enters a LUXU BOX overlooking the game. The crowd is almost exclusively ULTRA RICH CHINESE MEN AN WOMEN, enjoying the buffet, the bar, and the company of a SUPERMODELS and CELEBRITIES. Jess wanders in, convinced she’s in the wrong place until Nicky waves from the BALCONY, motions for her to come ove  46.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The game is in full swing as Nicky and Jess enjoy themsel and watch from their prime seats on the balcony.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: How’d you get these tickets? He points out seven foot six YAO MING inside the suite. T share a wave.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Yao Ming’s a friend. Jess and Nicky turn their attention back to the field.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Is this a bad time to mention I don’t really like football? I mean it just seems like a lot of standing around all the time...

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Lots of standing, with brief moments of head trauma. An awkward beat, he looks to the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well, if you don’t like football we can still make it fun... (sees something) Okay, look- He points to the STANDS BELOW where a VENDOR is preparing toss a HOT DOG to a FAN eight seats down the row.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dollar says that guy misses the catch.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: (smiling, game ) Let’s make it a sawbuck.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Done. THEIR POV: The Vendor THROWS. The fan MISSES the hot dog.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: AH!! How’d you know?  47.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: That guy can’t throw. A ROAR as the crowd starts to DO THE WAVE on the other si of the stadium.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: (searching the crowd) Okay- there- shirtless guy with the body paint. Sawbuck says he’s too drunk to get up for the wave.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: You sure? His team is on a drive.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: You in or out?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: In. The WAVE COMES AROUND- the man does not get up.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Yessss!! I know my drunks.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Nice. They're having fun. Nicky spots another opportunity.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay- there- the mamacita in the short shorts... In the stands below, a shapely CUBANA is making her way f her seat down the row TOWARD THE AISLE.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How many guys will check her out on the way up the aisle? Closest without going over wins.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: End seats only? At least ten.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: There’s a play on. I say three.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Six. They turn to see a CHINESE INDUSTRIALIST sitting nearby.  48.

dialogues.speaker: INDUSTRIALIST
dialogues.text: Can I get in on this?

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Sure. Ten bucks- Mister...?

dialogues.speaker: INDUSTRIALIST
dialogues.text: Liyuan. I say six guys look. Sure thing. They nod in agreement and turn their attention to the Mamacita as she steps onto the aisle. The FIRST GUY she passes checks out her shorts.

dialogues.speaker: JESS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: That’s one. THEIR POV: A SECOND GUY looks. Then a THIRD. Then a FOURT

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Damn... A FIFTH, A SIXTH. She climbs to the last step, exiting-

dialogues.speaker: LIYUAN
dialogues.text: It’s six! But at the last second a SEVENTH MAN turns and rubberneck

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: SEVEN! Yes! (to Liyuan) You’re over! Whooo! I know my letches too!! Money money money! She holds out her hand and Mr. Liyuan pays with a smile.

dialogues.speaker: LIYUAN
dialogues.text: (playful) I want justice! I want my money back! Make another bet.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY / JESS
dialogues.text: Sure... okay...

dialogues.speaker: LIYUAN
dialogues.text: Which team draws the next foul?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Offense.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Uh- I don’t know football... you boys play.  49.

dialogues.speaker: LIYUAN
dialogues.text: (to Nicky) Okay, defense. A thousand dollars? A moment. Unexpected, but Nicky is game.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: ON THE FIELD: The play begins. In moments WHISTLES are bl a YELLOW FLAG FLIES. The LEAD OFFICIAL announces the penalty.

dialogues.speaker: LEAD OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: Holding! Number 25. Offense. Five yards, second down! Liyuan loses, but takes it in stride. Jess is excited.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Whoa!

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Wooo! Liyuan peels off 2000 DOLLARS from a big roll.

dialogues.speaker: LIYUAN
dialogues.text: No way that was a hold. Double or nothing they make the first down. Nicky thinks a beat. He seems to be fighting an urge. He stretches his neck, then...

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Okay... ON THE FIELD- The SNAP... the THROW... the CATCH... the

dialogues.speaker: TACKLE... FIRST DOWN
dialogues.text: ON LIYUAN, cringing with another loss. Nicky reaches for cash. lLiyuan STOPS HIM, more MONEY in hand.

dialogues.speaker: LIYUAN
dialogues.text: Five thousand. Do they pass or run? Jess tries to make eye contact with Nicky but in the grip his affliction he ignores her.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Call it.  50.

dialogues.speaker: LIYUAN
dialogues.text: They run. ON THE FIELD: The SNAP, the BLITZ, the QB cocks his arm b

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: (hopeful) Oh! BACK ON THE QB: He sees an alley and RUNS. Liyuan WINS.

dialogues.speaker: LIYUAN
dialogues.text: Yeah!!! Nicky smiles, beaten.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Ouch...

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Okay, I’ve learned my lesson. (to waitress) Can I get a beer? Liyuan is charged up.

dialogues.speaker: LIYUAN
dialogues.text: I give you double or nothing. Your bet. Nicky takes a deep breath, thinking. As he exhales...

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Nah...

dialogues.speaker: LIYUAN
dialogues.text: Easy bet, easy bet. They make this kick, you win. Good odds right? They always make the kick. You can’t lose. Nicky considers it. Jess grows uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: LIYUAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: C’mon- I like to play. I like you.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Fine. So what’s that?

dialogues.speaker: LIYUAN
dialogues.text: Ten thousand. Nicky heaves a breath.  51.

dialogues.speaker: LIYUAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Too much?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I got it. You?

dialogues.speaker: LIYUAN
dialogues.text: I always play big. He points to his BODYGUARD who holds a BRIEFCASE.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Ten thousand they make it.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: ON THE FIELD: The SNAP, the KICK... DEFLECTED!

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO
dialogues.text: JESS CRINGES at Nicky’s loss. Liyuan GROANS in faux sympa

dialogues.speaker: LIYUAN
dialogues.text: Oh no... sorry... I’m a lucky guy. Nicky looks a little shaken. Jess is concerned.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Maybe we should g-

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Fifty thousand. Heads turn. Nicky has fire in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fifty thousand they down the punt. No return.

dialogues.speaker: LIYUAN
dialogues.text: Ahhh. Now you make things interesting. (then) Okay. ON THE FIELD-- The PUNT flies down the field... ON NICKY, JESS and LIYUAN-- Nerves fraying. ON THE BALL as it descends into the arms of a RECEIVER an HE RUNS.  52. ON NICKY, deflating, fifty grand lighter. Jess is sick to her stomach. Liyuan is thrilled. And before Jess can console Nicky--

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: (defiant) A hundred thousand!

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Whoa!

dialogues.speaker: LIYUAN
dialogues.text: Hundred thousand? You don’t have a hundred thousand...

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Sure I do. Nicky reaches under his seat, pulls up THE BLACK DUFFLE B HORST GAVE HIM and pulls out TEN BANDED STACKS OF HUNDRED Jess recognizes the bag.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: You can’t do that.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: It’s fine. (to Liyuan) How about you? Liyuan’s bodyguard pops open the BRIEFCASE next to Liyuan It’s full of banded stacks of cash. Nicky nods.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Next pass - incomplete.

dialogues.speaker: LIYUAN
dialogues.text: (satisfied) I say he catches it.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: ON THE FIELD: The SNAP... The BLITZ... The THROW. ...the CATCH. Nicky loses again.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO
dialogues.text: ON NICKY-- Shaken, absorbing the loss. The room goes eeri QUIET except for the Rolling Stones’ SYMPATHY FOR THE DEV playing on the suite’s sound system.  53. Liyuan smiles. Nicky might be in shock. Jess grabs him.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: We're going. She leads him to the door. Nicky looks like he’s asphyxiating. The walls are closing in on him. Jess reaches for the handle. And as the door opens, NICKY TURNS, marches back and-- SPILLS THE WHOLE BAGFUL OF CASH ON A POKER TABLE in the middle of the suite.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: All of it.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Nicky! Liyuan comes forward. Interested. It’s a lot of cash.

dialogues.speaker: JESS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (sotto, pissed) That’s my money too. Nicky ignores her and grabs a nearby DECK of cards.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Million one. High card takes it. Liyuan is on the spot. He’s uncomfortable for a beat. The he blurts out a LAUGH--

dialogues.speaker: LIYUAN
dialogues.text: You're crazy! I like it! He motions to his bodyguard to bring more cash.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: You first. Liyuan steps up to the table, takes a breath. He reaches the deck, holds his hand on it- WAITING FOR HIS MOMENT. T He CUTS the deck to show THE FIVE OF CLUBS. The guests voice Liuyan’s disappointment with a COLLECTIV ‘OOOH...’ Liyuan’s face falls. His first vulnerable momen

dialogues.speaker: LIYUAN
dialogues.text: (in mandarin) Ah fuck...  54. Jess GASPS, semi relieved. NICKY’S TURN. He puts his hand on the deck, staring down Liyuan with an intense predatory stare. Nicky smiles. He looks down. He CUTS and turns over... THE THREE OF HEARTS. Nicky loses. The world goes swimmy. Nicky’s suddenly a fly in Vaseline Jess's knees BUCKLE and she thuds into the sofa behind he LARGE CHINESE BODYGUARDS close in around Liyuan and the c A walleyed Nicky watches helplessly until suddenly-- -he snaps out of it and hastily heads for the door, full sober self hatred. As he passes Jess-—

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Let’s go. It’s over. He doesn’t even wait for her as marches out. She can’t sp A bodyguard OPENS THE DOOR wide as Nicky approaches. Then as he crosses the threshold--

dialogues.speaker: LIYUAN
dialogues.text: Sorry friend- that’s what happens when you play with the big boys. Nicky stops short. Things slow way down again. He burns.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: (off Nicky’s expression) Oh fuck me... Nicky turns.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Give me double or nothing.

dialogues.speaker: LIYUAN
dialogues.text: Oh man dude- what are you doing? Just go home.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Double or nothing. I’1l make it worth your while. Liyuan is a bit surprised. He thinks about it and--  55.

dialogues.speaker: LIYUAN
dialogues.text: No, I don’t think so. You got a problem my friend.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Take those binoculars. I'1l stay here. Pick any player on or off the field- any one at all. And I’1l guess who it is. Jess is aghast.

dialogues.speaker: LIYUAN
dialogues.text: Any player? That’s 60 to one.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: 2 mill- I’m good for it.

dialogues.speaker: LIYUAN
dialogues.text: That's fucking crazy. (bothered) I don’t like it...

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Fine. Pick any player on the field. He points to JESS.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: .--and she’1l point him out.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: (agog) What!? No-

dialogues.speaker: LIYUAN
dialogues.text: (wowed) You're fucking crazy! (thinks about it, then) But I can’t turn down free money. All are abuzz as Liyuan grabs the binoculars and heads fo the balcony.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: What are you doing?! Don’t drag me into this? Its not enough you lost everyone’s money. My money?! Nicky puts a hand on her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Calm down.  56.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Get your hands off me! You’re sick!

dialogues.speaker: LIYUAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: She reminds me of my wife... Nicky tunes her out, turns his attention to Liyuan.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: It’s a big bet Liuyan. Take your time. Liyuan scans the field. He settles on something. A smile.

dialogues.speaker: LIYUAN
dialogues.text: Got one. Want me to write it down?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I trust you. (re: Jess) Now it’s her turn.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: I’m not doing this.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Just pick.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: LIYUAN
dialogues.text: He’s crazy, I know. But it will be his fault, not yours. With a deep breath, she reluctantly agrees. She joins Liy by the balcony and takes the binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: JESS POV: She pans over the field pausing on various play ON JESS, the pressure is killing her. ON NICKY, calm but concerned. JESS POV: More scanning of the field, the sidelines... ON JESS, clueless.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Uhhhbh... ON LIYUAN, amused.  57.

dialogues.speaker: JESS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the hell am I supposed to do? Liyuan turns to Nicky.

dialogues.speaker: LIYUAN
dialogues.text: I give you a chance to back out okay? No hard feelings. Nicky just shakes his head. Tension mounting.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Oh god... I don’t know... JESS POV: She pauses on Player #30 on the sidelines, move on a few to the right, then back to #30.

dialogues.speaker: JESS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well I guess number... wait-- She sees something, she pans back to the right.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: JESS POV: There, on the sidelines, an INCREDIBLY LARGE LINEMAN catches her eye. She readjusts her view... .-.IT’S FAT ASS FARHAD, in uniform number 55, talking to COACH on the sidelines. JESS takes her eyes away from the binoculars, swallowing surprise. Nicky sees this from across the room, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: JESS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Number fifty five. ON LIYUAN. All eyes are on him. He slowly shakes his head it a no? Or---

dialogues.speaker: LIYUAN
dialogues.text: I don’t believe it... (blown away) FUCK! That is unbelievable!!! GASPS from the guests as they grapple with the upset. Jes instinctively jumps into character.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: (innocent) I'm right?! Oh my God! I’m right?!  58.

dialogues.speaker: LIYUAN
dialogues.text: (wowed disbelief) Yes!! You're fucking right! Fucking shit!! You’re fucking right!!! Crazy!!! Nicky starts collecting the cash and the briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: You’re not mad?

dialogues.speaker: LIYUAN
dialogues.text: (crazed delight) Fuck no! We have to go to Vegas right now!!! I have a jet!!! That was incredible!! Liyuan turns to anyone who will listen as

dialogues.speaker: LIYUAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did you see that!? Did you see what she did!?? Jess slips over to Nicky as he finishes packing up the mo

dialogues.speaker: LIYUAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And you dude! You have big fucking balls! You are my new fucking hero! Nicky smiles wide. Then--

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Double or nothing?

dialogues.speaker: LIYUAN
dialogues.text: (crazed delight) No fucking way!!! Get the fuck out of my suite!!! And as they all LAUGH and make their exit--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE SIDELINES, Farhad is talking to a COACH. We see no

dialogues.speaker: FAT ASS FARHAD
dialogues.text: I think I’m good coach. Consider your debt settled. Farhad grabs a Gatorade and walks off the field.  59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicky and Jess walk with hastened pace to a waiting LIMO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicky can finally relax as they drive off and Jess can no longer contain herself.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: I’m going to kill you!!!

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: You did great. She SWATS him repeatedly and excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: How did you do that?!!

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Liyuan is a legendary gambler. Bets on everything. Anything. Huge cash bets all the time. Once- the Bellagio kicked Bill Gates out of the High Roller Suite because they heard Liyuan was flying in. He’s the perfect vic.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: But how did you know who he was gonna pick!?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Because we told him to. We’ve been telling him all day long...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEGIN FLASHBACK SEQUENCE of earlier that day-- Liyuan exits his suite with bodyguards, enters the ELEVAT

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: From the moment he left his room this morning we've been priming him- programming his subconscious. He’s been seeing the number fifty five all day long...  60. IN THE ELEVATOR, an large ADVERTISEMENT for a WINE BAR in hotel named “55 Degrees”. Liyuan pays it little mind.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: On the elevator, in the lobby... IN THE LOBBY, Liyuan is briefly CUT OFF by a group of FAN (actually GARETH and some others we recognize from the co team). They are all WEARING #55 JERSEYS.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...even the stickpin on the Doorman. AS HE EXITS, Liyuan is greeted by HORST, dressed as a DOORMAN. PUSH IN ON HIS LAPEL to see a #55 STICK PIN.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. LIMO AND MIAMI STREETS
dialogues.text: Liyuan rides in a limo, occasionally glancing out the win

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: .+-Not only that, we loaded his route from the hotel to the stadium. He looks out the window, primers are everywhere. VARIOUS CUTS- seemingly EVERYDAY EVENTS outside the limo given a CLOSER LOOK. Undercover ACCOMPLICES are everywhere: As PEDESTRIANS in JERSEYS, as PROTESTERS wearing matching color TEES with 5 their SIGNS, BILLBOARDS featuring FARHAD, etc...

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ..-He doesn’t see it, but he does. Team colors, fifty fives, even Farhad... AT A TRAFFIC LIGHT: HONKING gets Liyuan’s attention. He turns to see FARHAD DRIVING A TAXI- honking and yelling.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Suggestions are everywhere- the number of flowers in a vase, the tramp stamp on the hooker we sent to his room last night. FLASH CUT TO A NAKED WOMAN’S LOWER BACK as Liyuan fucks h from behind. The number 55 is disguised as a TRIBAL TATTO  61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ACCOMPLICE replaces the iPod in the suite’s iPod DOCK PRESSES PLAY.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It’s also what he hears- from the words I choose, to the music in his suite. FLASHBACK of Nicky challenging Liyuan to the big bet as SYMPATHY FOR THE DEVIL plays on the iPod DOCK.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The Mandarin word for five is ‘woo’. There are 124 woo-woos in ‘Sympathy For the Devil’... FLASHBACK ON LIYUAN looking through the binoculars, scann the field and eventually spotting Farhad.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He doesn’t register it, but its all there. And when he looks through those binoculars and he spots the biggest guy on the field he’s ever seen in his life with the number fifty five on his Jersey? Some little voice deep in the back of his head says, “That’s it”. He thinks it’s intuition and picks. A sly smile on Liyuan’s face. Then, as we've already seen

dialogues.speaker: LIYUAN
dialogues.text: I got one. Want me to write it down?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I trust you. (re: Jess) Now it’s her turn.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: I’m not doing this! And as the scene plays on-

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And you being in the dark and flopping around like a trout ina creel made it even more believable.  62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BACK IN THE PRESENT, Jess’ excitement is unabated.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: (delighted) You are such an asshole!! He laughs as she continues to swat at him.

dialogues.speaker: JESS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There’s no way that can really work!

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Quick- what continent is Kenya on?
