dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Africa.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: What are the colors of a chess board?

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Black and white?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Name an animal.

dialogues.speaker: JESS NICKY
dialogues.text: Zebra. Zebra. Jess is amazed.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: 85 percent of the time people say zebra. The human brain. Hackable.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: So you had an 85 percent chance?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Farhad had it at about 59%. Better odds than Vegas.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: What if he picked wrong?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Just double down again until it happens. It’s probabilistic.  63.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Well you're still an asshole.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: You wanted to learn- welcome to the grift. She swats him again. He fights back a little as things be more playful. He gets a hold of her arms, neutralizing her attack until She darts forward, KISSING HIM HARD. He quickly reciproca It’s a long kiss, but they break for air eventually- star at one another for an extended beat-- heaving breaths, ey speaking unheard doubts and desires. Then-- They resume- passionately and intensely. The chemistry is undeniable, it’s real. It’s intimate. It’s building. They manage the occasional comment between kisses.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’ve wanted this a long time.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: What the hell were you waiting for? They’re consumed by one another instantly. Hands greedily fumbling with clothing. He reaches sensually into her hair and pulls her away fro him for a brief moment- admiring her.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Didn't know if I could trust you... He leans in, she holds him back for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: And now...? It burns in his eyes. He pulls her into a passionate kiss INT. SETAI HOTEL - JESS’ SUITE - NIGHT Their two bodies lie still, facing one another, intertwin in the sheets of Jess’ suite. We move in slowly, closing in on Jess’ sleeping face. CAMERA ARCS AROUND to reveal Nicky, awake and gazing at h  64. Jess stirs. Her sleepy eyes opening for a moment to find there. A small smile, then-

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Go to sleep... She reaches to pull him closer--

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: You go to sleep... She gives him a little kiss. She sleepily prods him--

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Such a jerk... made me look like an idiot...

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Next time you’1ll be in on it.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Promise?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Promise.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Next time, you’re the idiot... She smiles. He gives her a kiss and she drifts back to sl Nicky reflects pleasantly. But soon his expression change There’s concern. Conflict. FADE OUT. INT. SETAI HOTEL - JESS’ SUITE - MORNING OPEN WIDE as sunlight floods the room, eventually REVEALI Jess in the bed, alone. She wakes, notices immediately he’s gone. Rising slightly, she looks around with concern, but the SOUNDS of milling about in the adjoining room of her suit soothe her concerns. She slips into a robe and heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Jess shuffles into the living room with a smile to find a HOUSEKEEPER, not Nicky. Both are surprised.  65.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Oh... Jess turns back as the Housekeeper apologizes in SPANISH, entering her bedroom to find-- A FEW STACKS OF CASH on the dresser. Her cut. A note. “Goodbye” Pain wells in her eyes. CUT TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: OVER BLACK
dialogues.text: “THREE YEARS LATER” The searing WHINE of a 19000 RPM ENGINE and the gut pound RUMBLE of exhaust builds on the soundtrack until--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FORMULA ONE CAR screams around the track on a test run the famous racing complex. It zooms past the near empty stands, where a daytime COCK PARTY is in progress. A few of the fabulous crowd take no and CHEER, perched over the railing. BACK ON THE CAR, circling the track, passing-- IN THE PIT other cars IDLE or are in various states of maintenance. Members of RACING TEAM GARRIGA diligently wo their various jobs as their driver gets a feel for the tr IN THE STANDS sits Spanish team owner RAFAEL LAMARCA GARC GARRIGA-- 40, wildly wealthy and even more powerful. It o out of every pore. He sits alone, sipping on an espresso and surveying his t from on high. GARRIGA POV: Through the bustle trackside we find NICKY talking to a rather severe and ominous 60 year old WELSHM Garriga’s head of security, WILLIAM OWENS. They huddle around a bank of monitoring equipment and Nic points out the readings on several LCD screens.  66. Owens offers no emotion as he listens. Eventually, he ste away-- headed for the stands. Garriga takes another sip of his espresso, never taking h eyes off the track until--

dialogues.speaker: GARRIGA
dialogues.text: I wasn’t expecting such a kind face... Owens is next to him now. He speaks in a thick WELSH BROG

dialogues.speaker: OWENS
dialogues.text: The tech says his gizmo checks out. But in complete candor I don’t like this-- and I don’t like this boy.

dialogues.speaker: GARRIGA
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: OWENS
dialogues.text: He’s a con man, sir.

dialogues.speaker: GARRIGA
dialogues.text: That’s the point.

dialogues.speaker: OWENS
dialogues.text: I've dealt with guys like him when I was at 85 Albert. Slippery fish.

dialogues.speaker: GARRIGA
dialogues.text: I did not say you had to trust him. Just to be sure he does his job.

dialogues.speaker: OWENS
dialogues.text: That I will. My eyes are open and I keep my 1911 well fed. Garriga is amused.

dialogues.speaker: GARRIGA
dialogues.text: Invite him to lunch. Owens nods even though Garriga has never removed his eyes from the track.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before the huge windows in the empty dining area overlook the track, Garriga, Owens and Nicky have lunch.  67.

dialogues.speaker: GARRIGA
dialogues.text: You are a man known for great skills of persuasion and deception. Nicky nods gently.

dialogues.speaker: GARRIGA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You were very hard for me to find.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I'd been out of it for a while.

dialogues.speaker: GARRIGA
dialogues.text: So why did you take my offer?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Ran out of money. Garriga smiles. He’s disarmingly charming.

dialogues.speaker: GARRIGA
dialogues.text: I love everything about what we do. Drivers risk their lives for glory. The competition, the constant innovation, new materials, exotic fabrication- all of it to gain a fraction of a second on your competition. It is a sport of nanoseconds. Millions of dollars to get the slightest edge. (then) My car- You saw it?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Beautiful...

dialogues.speaker: GARRIGA
dialogues.text: Easily $400 million dollars in R and D. Ferrari, McEwen, Lotus, they spend half of that. (then) But still I have a problem. Ten years ago at LeMans I was young and I was drunk and I declared Team Garriga would dominate the sport within a decade. And over that decade we have come very close. This year McEwen is the only team standing in my way. (then) But I have something none of them have.  68.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: The EXR. The fuel burn algorithm.

dialogues.speaker: GARRIGA
dialogues.text: Yes, they all want it. My engineers promise it guarantees me a win. But that’s not enough for me. Perhaps I am paranoid. Or perhaps I am too proud. But I will not lose. That is why I wanted you.

dialogues.speaker: OWENS
dialogues.text: This needs to be discreet. It needs to be safe. No holes.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: The plan is as we’ve discussed. I pose as a disgruntled contractor offering to sell the EXR to the McEwen Team. But that’s not what I'll give them. I’11l give them a fake designed by a friend of mine. They’1l load it into their car's tuning control unit. It will test well- but it doesn’t do anything. Basically it just gives a false reading to their instruments. It’1ll mislead the driver enough to give you an added edge.

dialogues.speaker: GARRIGA
dialogues.text: How much of an edge?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Not much. Two thirds of a second every few laps? Imperceptible. Undetectable.

dialogues.speaker: GARRIGA
dialogues.text: Two thirds of a second is a gracious plenty. Owens nods. Then-

dialogues.speaker: OWENS
dialogues.text: Just because the techs say it checks out, what makes you think you can convince them you're absolutely real? That you’re completely authentic? You can’t be dicking around boy.  69.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: You don’t need to worry about that. I’m well researched. We’re good to go. (then) The Grand Prix Kickoff party at our hotel tonight...

dialogues.speaker: GARRIGA
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I’ll be there early. I’1l be seen drinking, bragging and boisterous. At some point in the evening I'll approach you in view of the McEwen team. An argument ensues. I’1l throw down my drink, I'll yell, I‘1l shove you- Security will throw me out. At that point it’1ll have it’s own inertia. McEwen’11 probably contact me right there. If not, I’1l go to him.

dialogues.speaker: GARRIGA
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Just so we understand. Whatever I sell it for- I keep all of it. Plus the million from you. Owens and Garriga agree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nestled into the beautiful city of Buenos Aires, a gorgeo hip hotel plays host to a kickoff party of Grand Prix wee Outside is a lavish affair where the race teams, dignitar VIP spectators and generally fabulous folks enjoy themsel as music thumps over it all. Nicky arrives, working his way through the crowd. He pass a RACE FAN COUPLE getting an autograph from a FAMOUS DRIV The HUSBAND offers his camera to passing Nicky.

dialogues.speaker: HUSBAND
dialogues.text: Take our picture?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Sure.  70. Nicky gladly grabs the camera and quickly pops off a phot the couple and the driver.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One for safety... He snaps another and returns the camera. Moving on, he sp GARRIGA AND OWENS in a distant corner, regards them a mom then turns his gaze to ANOTHER SET OF VIP’S. NICKY POV: A burly, ebullient AUSTRALIAN TEAM OWNER (MORG MCEWEN, 50’s) hugs his DRIVER who wears a TEAM MCEWEN JAC Nicky turns his attention to the BAR. He’s greeted by an Argentine BARTENDER whose name tag reads, “MARCELLO”.

dialogues.speaker: MARCELLO
dialogues.text: (in SPANISH) What may I get you sir?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: (in SPANISH) Marcello, is it? I have a favor to ask.

dialogues.speaker: MARCELLO
dialogues.text: Yes sir?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I'm here on business with a client who loves to drink. But I'ma recovering alcoholic so when I order a Vodka martini rocks can you just give me water and olives instead?

dialogues.speaker: MARCELLO
dialogues.text: (in English) Of course sir. Understood.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Vodka Martini. Rocks. Marcello nods and prepares a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC as Nicky MINGLES at the party, talking to various guests- LAUGHING, CHATTING and most of all, DRINKING. ON NICKY, talking up a guest, “tipsy” and disparaging.  71.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: -.-he’s a real son of a bitch as far as I’m concerned. Do you know if Garriga is Spanish for thief? (then) Forget it. I don’t want to ruin the party... sorry man... In a BRIEF MONTAGE, we watch him grow increasingly “drunk he downs several water Martinis. He LAUGHS loudly and sloppily FLIRTS with a pretty woman- briefly catching MCEWEN’S eye- just enough to make an impression.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (pointing across room) There he is right there. Commander in Thief. Stole my designs. Could have been millions in it for me. Guess you can do whatever you want if you're a rich prick...

dialogues.speaker: PRETTY WOMAN
dialogues.text: Maybe you should slow down a little. Drink some water...

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: No. I’m gonna talk to him. Its a free country.

dialogues.speaker: PRETTY WOMAN
dialogues.text: Just calm down.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I’m going... He staggers off. ON NICKY, heading across the room to Owens and Garriga. Owens gives a subtle nod. Nicky acknowledges him. But as he makes his way across to Garriga, he STOPS sudde falling out of character. His face falls. IT’S JESS, looking stunning in a gorgeous dress and makin INCREDIBLE ENTRANCE from across the crowded space. Confident on her heels, confident in all ways, she saunte toward him with smoldering intensity. She seems a complet different woman, but it’s definitely her. Nicky is thrown for a loop as she comes closer. She doesn see him but continues on, smiling at the sight of someone  72. Nicky turns to see who, only to find GARRIGA spreading hi arms at the sight of her. She walks right into Garriga’s arms and gives him a more- a-friend kiss. Nicky tries to absorb this shocking development. Shaken, veers off course and heads for an EXIT.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: ON JESS, with Garriga, taking a sip from his drink.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Is this a Pisco Sour? I’1l have one of these sweetie.

dialogues.speaker: GARRIGA
dialogues.text: Of course bonita... And as Garriga orders a drink from a nearby WAITER, Jess catches sight of Nicky leaving the party. She calmly observes him and after a few moments leans close to Garri

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: I’m just gonna run to the ladies...

dialogues.speaker: GARRIGA
dialogues.text: Of course...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Away from the party on a large terrace, Nicky looks out a the beautiful grounds as he tries to process things. After a few beats, the sound of women’s HEELS. He turns t see Jess approaching. They silently size each other up.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Well hello.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Just here for the race.  73.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Should be a good one. (then, changing subject) Long time.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Yeah. (then, changing subject) So you're with um...?

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Rafael Garriga. Yes. He owns one of the teams. Nicky pauses. Acknowledgment or a pang of jealousy?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Oh. Great. Is he a mark?

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: No. We’re together. Have been for a long time. I’m out of the game.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Oh. Good. Good for you.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: What about you?

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: I looked for you, you know. Guilt plays behind his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: You shouldn’t have...

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: What was I supposed to do?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Hate me. Forget me.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Is that what you did? Just forget?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I made a mistake.  74.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: What? Sleeping with me? Bringing me in? Talking to me in that bar? Before he can answer--

dialogues.speaker: JESS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You left me back at square one you know? Wandering. So I did what you said- worked alone. Got on the party circuit, boosting watches and traveling for a year before I met Rafael in Valencia. We've been together ever since. He’s a good guy. Generous. Kind.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Glad to hear it... I’m sorry if I--

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: No, you did me a favor. Rafael has changed my entire life. I’m in love. I’m happy. I should be thanking you. Nicky absorbs this. He smiles half-heartedly.

dialogues.speaker: JESS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Guess I’1ll see you around. She gives a kiss on the cheek. A friend’s kiss.

dialogues.speaker: JESS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But look- he doesn’t know about my past so-- you don’t know me. Okay? He gets it, but it seems like it hurts to hear it.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Okay. He’s left watching her walk away, regretful. He reaches into his lapel pocket, searching for his walle It’s still there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicky bellies up to another bar at the party- raising a h to the BARTENDER.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Vodka.  75. The bartender places a drink before Nicky. Nicky takes a gulp, but is quickly disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is water.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Yes sir. I have spoken with Marcello. Nicky looks across the party. Marcello looks back at him a big thumbs up. Nicky tries again.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Give me a real one.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Sir, I couldn't.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: It’s okay. I need a drink. Several actually.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: He told me to be strong for you.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I’1ll talk to Marcello. EXT. HOTEL - MARCELLO’S BAR - MOMENTS LATER Nicky bellies up to Marcello’s bar.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Okay Marcello, you did a great job. We're good now. But I really need a drink so I want you to make me real one. Alright?

dialogues.speaker: MARCELLO
dialogues.text: Understood sir.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Actually make it a double.

dialogues.speaker: MARCELLO
dialogues.text: Coming right up.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Marcello pours a huge one into a glass in front of Nicky. takes a swig.  76.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: This is water.

dialogues.speaker: MARCELLO
dialogues.text: (to be heard) No sir, it is a real drink. Absolutely one hundred percent genuine.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Who are you talking to? Just give me a drink.

dialogues.speaker: MARCELLO
dialogues.text: I misunderstood sir. I’m sorry... He turns to make another.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: No- do it here. Do it right in front of me. Marcello complies and begins to make the drink right befo him with the proper ingredients.

dialogues.speaker: MARCELLO
dialogues.text: What do I care? It is not my life. What does it matter if you come home at three a.m? If you yell and scream at your wife while your children cower under the bed afraid for their mother’s life? Until one day, one of those children comes out from beneath the bed and pushes YOU against the wall and yells NO MORE PAPI! NO MORE! I am the man of this family now and you can go to hell! Marcello places the drink in front of Nicky. He picks it ignoring what he just heard and holds it in front of his for a long beat. Then, guiltily-

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Fuck you Marcello. He slams down the drink and storms off. Marcello is proud his tough love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON A WAITER with a trayful of drinks. Nicky CUTS HIM OFF, stopping him in his tracks.  77. Nicky grabs the tray- and stares down the waiter until he lets go of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Nicky, sitting on the diving board, drinking while watching Jess and Garriga from afar. The tray is next to half of the glasses are empty. He remains indifferent as Owens joins him.

dialogues.speaker: OWENS
dialogues.text: Are you drunk?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: OWENS
dialogues.text: What part of the plan calls for a tray full of Lemon Drops, Apple- tinis, and Goldschlager shots? Are you pledging a sorority house?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I think I may need to rethink the plan.

dialogues.speaker: OWENS
dialogues.text: Why? What’s going on? Something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: No. I’m just not feeling it.

dialogues.speaker: OWENS
dialogues.text: You're not feeling it? This isn’t Jazzfest, Thelonious. What’s your reason?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Nothing. Forget it. I’m fine. Just waiting for the right time.

dialogues.speaker: OWENS
dialogues.text: You sure? Mr. Garriga is not a guy you want to cross... me neither. So if there’s something you need to say, say it.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I said it. I’m waiting for the right time.  78.

dialogues.speaker: OWENS
dialogues.text: God damned primadonna delicate science bullshit. You’re not smashing atoms here. This isn’t CERN. Just do what you’re being paid to do. (mutters ) Shitheel... Owens exits. Nicky shoots back another drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garriga and Jess LAUGH at an unheard joke. She swats him.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Rafael!!

dialogues.speaker: GARRIGA
dialogues.text: Funny, right?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey you!!! They turn to see a very drunk Nicky standing nearby. Owen is tense. Jess is freaked out.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Oh God...

dialogues.speaker: GARRIGA
dialogues.text: Don’t worry. He’s a disgruntled engineer. SMASH! Nicky throws down his glass. Many guests, includin McEwen turn. GARRIGA (CONT’D) I expect you have to something to say to m-- WHACK! Nicky knocks Garriga off his feet with a very unexpected punch to the face.

dialogues.speaker: OWENS
dialogues.text: (surprised by punch) Oh shit--

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: What are you doing!? Garriga hits the ground as the whole room turns to watch. McEwen is one of them. Owens rushes in as--  79. WHAM!! Nicky dives atop Garriga, punching and wrestling w him as Owens tries to pull him off.

dialogues.speaker: GARRIGA
dialogues.text: (to Nicky) Why are you punching me? (WHACK) I thought we were shoving. (WHACK)

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: You take my ideas, you claim them as you’re own. You stole from me!! ON JESS: Not sure how to react. ON NICKY, wildly attacking Garriga.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’M SO DISGRUNTLED!!! Owens and party SECURITY finally peel him off Garriga as tries to figure out what’s going on.

dialogues.speaker: GARRIGA
dialogues.text: Get him out of here! MCEWEN watches as they drag Nicky away while Garriga trie urge the guests to resume enjoying the party. McEwen turn and whispers something to his BODYGUARD standing next to ON OWENS, yanking Nicky and whispering in his ear.

dialogues.speaker: OWENS
dialogues.text: Oversold it a bit didn’t you?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I was caught in the moment... Owens shoves him off, letting security take him out the r of the way. ON JESS, icing Garriga’'s face as he sits recovering.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: GARRIGA
dialogues.text: The racing business bonita. That’s all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Security escorts Nicky out of the party and across the lo toward the front door.  80.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: You can’t throw me out-- I’m staying here.

dialogues.speaker: MASSIVE SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Let’s see your key. Nicky digs in his pocket and produces his KEYCARD. Satisfied, they THROW HIM to the floor and walk away. Nicky lays on the refreshingly cool marble of the lobby f when TWO FEET settle to a stop next to his head. He looks up to find McEwen’s hulking bodyguard, GORDON, looking down at him.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: Mr. McEwen would like to have lunch in his suite tomorrow. Information is on the card. Gordon drops a card on his chest and walks off. Nicky smi and slowly rises to his feet to make his way to his room that he can spend the night vomiting. FADE OUT. I/E. MCEWEN’S SUITE - DAY Gordon lets Nicky into the palatial suite and escorts him into the living room area. The drapes dance on the breeze blowing in from the balcony doors. Corpulent McEwen is outside, enjoying the view. MUSIC fro the pool area below can be heard as Nicky joins him by th railing. They stare outward, side by side. A long pause, then-

dialogues.speaker: MCEWEN
dialogues.text: Ever heard of Udo Pappenphus?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: No sir.

dialogues.speaker: MCEWEN
dialogues.text: An engineer for Ferrari for many years. Brilliant. Moved on a few times. McLaren, Toyota, different teams. A fun fellow. Curious fellow. With a name like Udo Pappenphus you’d damn well better be fun and curious...  81. He has Nicky’s attention.

dialogues.speaker: MCEWEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well one day, Udo Pappenphus was found behind a berm with his throat cut ear to ear. Like a giant grin. (then) Udo Pappenphus, a corporate spy? No. Udo Pappenphus was a good father, a brilliant engineer and a stupid cunt. Udo Pappenphus brought home a one inch square of experimental honeycomb carbon composite to show his 10 year old son... (by rote) ..-and they cut his throat from ear to ear like a giant grin or so the story goes. It hangs there.

dialogues.speaker: MCEWEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why tell you this tale? Other than the fact I like the sound of Udo Pappenphus as it strolls across my tongue? It’s a warning... of what you're getting yourself into. He was Garriga’s man.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I want three million dollars.

dialogues.speaker: MCEWEN
dialogues.text: That’s a lot of money.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: It’s the EXR.

dialogues.speaker: MCEWEN
dialogues.text: (surprised) Great God almighty... Nicky stares down at the pool party below.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Mmm hmm... NICKY POV: Jess is walking through the crowded pool area sexy outfit.  82.

dialogues.speaker: MCEWEN
dialogues.text: I thought maybe you’d have some shit like a dropped cockpit- blown diffuser nonsense... Nicky doesn’t answer, distracted.

dialogues.speaker: MCEWEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But the EXR? You’re Father Bloody Christmas come to me.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: (distracted) Uh huh...

dialogues.speaker: MCEWEN
dialogues.text: It’s mine anyway- God knows he stole all my engineers from me. As McEwen talks, Nicky walks along the railing to get a better look at her.

dialogues.speaker: MCEWEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m going to need to see proof. Nicky watches as Jess embraces Garriga, leaving McEwen waiting for an answer.

dialogues.speaker: MCEWEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you understand? Still no answer from staring Nicky.

dialogues.speaker: MCEWEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the hell are you looking at? Nicky snaps out of it as McEwen glances down to see.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MCEWEN
dialogues.text: Did the pool go Euro? (to inside) Gordon! Get my field glasses. McEwen squints, spotting Jess.

dialogues.speaker: MCEWEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ahhh. I see the one. She’s a beauty. Bet she’s one of those Formula One skanks who follows the circuit.  83.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: (offended) She’s not a race skank.

dialogues.speaker: MCEWEN
dialogues.text: Oh- do you know her?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: No, I’m just not getting a skanky vibe.

dialogues.speaker: MCEWEN
dialogues.text: Oh sure she is. The hotel’s lousy with them.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: She looks like a very nice girl.

dialogues.speaker: MCEWEN
dialogues.text: Sure. For the right price. McEwen laughs. Nicky scowls as McEwen keeps leering.

dialogues.speaker: MCEWEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Gah. Look at her buttocks. (inside) Gordon! Field glasses! Now!! (then) Chiseled marble lobes...

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: (bothered) Okay, can we get back to business?

dialogues.speaker: MCEWEN
dialogues.text: A little small on top, but who cares?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: (wanting to punch him) That's a very subjective topic. One man’s small is another man’s perfection.

dialogues.speaker: MCEWEN
dialogues.text: Maybe if you're booking a fashion show, but I’m talking about slapping balls!!

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: (annoyed, short) Listen- Do you want the stuff or not?  84.

dialogues.speaker: MCEWEN
dialogues.text: Of course I do. GORDON GET ME MY

dialogues.speaker: YABBY
dialogues.text: (then, to Nicky) But I’m gonna need proof first.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: You'll have it. I’11 contact you. Then it’s three million. Cash. Nicky exits, running into bodyguard GORDON as he’s delive SMALL BINOCULARS to McEwen. Nicky grabs them from him and quickly breaks them in half

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry. He gives them back and exits. EXT. POOL AREA BAR —- DAY A cloistered pool bar partially separated from the pool a by tall landscaping. Jess arrives with an empty glass. A BLONDE BARTENDER helps her.

dialogues.speaker: BLONDE BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Sangria? Jess nods as the bartender tops off her glass. Nicky appe behind her.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Let me get this one... Jess is not pleased.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Just having a drink.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: You don’t know me, remember?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Just having a drink. Stranger.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: What was that last night? Was that about me?  85.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: No. (then) Well, a little bit about you.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Are you working an angle on Rafael?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: No. I’m working for him. It’s nothing. Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Trust you. Of course.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I know. I deserve that-- but... when you grow up in this- with a father like mine, you don’t just trust people. It’s not done. It’s--

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Is that it? It’s all your dad’s fault? I get it. I forgive you okay? But if Rafael sees us, I don’t know what’s gonna happen. He’s the jealous type. Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: You're missing the point.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Oh really? Then tell me- what’s the point?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: The point is... I don’t know what the point is. A chance to explain? Talk? I don’t know- make it up to you? She thinks. She’s wrestling with something. A deep breath a big sigh, then-

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: To be perfectly honest. I was kind of happy to see you. It’s just-- I mean, three years is a long time. I guess I should just get over it... Nicky leaves a silence, hoping she’1ll say more.  86.

dialogues.speaker: JESS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Things with Rafael are... complicated. I was just painting a pretty picture. I mean, things are fine but... it’s a strange world and sometimes... She drifts off in thought for a moment, a vulnerability behind her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: JESS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I could actually use a... a distraction. You know? I get lonely here. He’s so busy... Her eyes start to well. She gathers herself.

dialogues.speaker: JESS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: God- I must sound like such a train wreck...

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: No. No, no... not at all.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: (big sigh) It was fun in Miami wasn’t it? Nicky smiles and nods. She moves closer.

dialogues.speaker: JESS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I kind of miss the game. I miss you. (she thinks) If I were to slip away. I mean, if I could... do you think...? (then) It’s a mistake, forget it. He leans in, seeing his chance.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: We can do whatever you want to do. I can keep you safe... She leans in even closer, whispering-

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: You taught me so much. But I’ve learned a lot since then. I'd really love to show you all the things I’ve learned... Nicky would like that. She moves toward his lips.  87. A KISS, gentle but simmering. Once it ends-

dialogues.speaker: JESS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Like how I learned how to play men like I just played you. Nicky instantly backs off, chiding himself. Jess smiles a skewers him.

dialogues.speaker: JESS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're pathetic. I think you’re losing it.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: When did you learn that?

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: “I'll keep you safe?” BLECH! What the hell was that? Does that get you laid?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: That was not a line!

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: I'm not falling for your shit again Nicky. And I’m very happy. Stay away from me. She walks away. Nicky admonishes himself. Then--

dialogues.speaker: JESS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And you're still an easy lift... She tosses back his wallet as she disappears from view, leaving Nicky wanting her more than ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jess emerges from Garriga’s Escalade and an Argentine SALESWOMAN opens the door to greet her.

dialogues.speaker: SALESWOMAN
dialogues.text: We've been expecting you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Splendid dresses all around.  88.

dialogues.speaker: SALESWOMAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Seflor Garriga’s assistant called. We pulled a few things they said you might like... Jess is at the mirror decked out in an amazing dress as t saleswoman stands beside her.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: I think this one would just about kill him.

dialogues.speaker: SALESWOMAN
dialogues.text: It’s breathtaking, is it not? It is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jess is laden with bags, continuing her shopping expediti Passing a BUS STOP where several ELDERLY PEOPLE get on a she notices a PURSE on the ground nearby. She tries to ge the attention of the boarding passengers...

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Whoa whoa-- wait! Hello? Hello! (realizing) I mean hola! Wait... Too late-- the bus door CLOSES and it pulls away. Frustra for a moment, Jess is overcome by a touch of her pickpock past as she picks up the purse. She looks around quickly then digs into the purse. Not mu an ADDRESS BOOK, some KEYS and a WALLET with a few PESOS PICTURES of a SWEET OLD COUPLE - The wife beaming and the husband in a WHEELCHAIR. She is overcome with guilt. She flips to the first page o the address book and quickly finds the woman’s informatio She dials the number. An OLD MAN answers.

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hola?

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Hola-- um, hi, your wife, um-- espousa? She--

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Que?  89.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Habla ingles?

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Que? No habla-- CLICK. He hangs up. Jess is stymied for a moment, then--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jess scans building numbers, referring to the address boo periodically. The Escalade follows her slowly. She comes upon a residential COURTYARD, entering to find--

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: So you do still have a heart. Grinning Nicky is seated at a garden table in the courtya with an open bottle of Malbec and two glasses. Jess is pi

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Oh God! Seriously?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: (as old man) Si, estoy muy en serio. She tosses the address book at him.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: You are a dick! Stop wasting my time! She stomps off. He follows.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: C’mon just sit with me. Have a little wine. Isn’t this romantic?

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Yes! Stalking really turns my crank She gets inside the Escalade and it drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jess huffs at her situation when, DING! Her phone receive a TEXT. She looks down to read-- "Sorry" DING! Another text:  90. “Didn't know how else to get your number"

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Dammit... She’s mad at herself, but also a little amused... INT. BUENOS AIRES HOTEL - NICKY’S ROOM - NIGHT It’s late. Nicky lounges on his bed, watching A_La Cama C Porcel on TV, eating gummy bears and drinking a beer. DING. His phone lights up with a TEXT. It’s Jess. “What's the matter? Can't sleep?” He quickly sits up, spilling his beer. He thinks a moment DING. Another text: “Your light is still on.” He looks to the window. Is she watching? DING. Another text. “Be at the terrace garden in 5.” A smile. He springs into action-- putting on a shirt and quickly freshening up in the bathroom mirror. He EXITS. Beat. He re-enters, smelling his armpits. Quickly applies deodorant, leaves again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicky arrives at the garden on the hotel grounds. He look for Jess. No sign of her. DING. A text: “Turn around” He slowly turns. He’s facing the hotel. DING. “Look up” He does. Scanning upward a few floors until he sees-- Jess, in heavy shadow, silhouetted by the light spilling her suite.  91. He watches as she slowly undoes the sash of her robe, not opening it. She turns and moves inside, diffused by the sheer curtain and warm light inside. Nicky walks with her as she enters the bedroom. He's rapt not noticing as he walks through a manicured flower bed. She stops, her back to him, still diffused by the curtain He stops and watches as she DROPS HER ROBE. Although obscured slightly by the curtains, he can see her turn he head and he can discern a sly smile. Then-- Garriga enters the bedroom, shirtless, hairy and libidino She turns to him and embraces him. Nicky shoulders his disappointment and frustration as the vanish from view. FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A McEwen F-1 car on a test run speeds past the pit where McEwen team is gathered. Nicky, McEwen and a McEwen TECH are huddled around a lapt

dialogues.speaker: MCEWEN
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: TECH
dialogues.text: It’s real. McEwen looks to Nicky.

dialogues.speaker: MCEWEN
dialogues.text: Three million huh?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I can have the entire package within 48 hours. Code, documentation, analysis. McEwen agrees.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait for my call. Nicky closes the laptop and exits.  92.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicky pulls up outside the baggage claim area in his SUV, glancing inside.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. BUENOS AIRES AIRPORT
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON rolling LUGGAGE and FEET, purposefully walking t the exit, PASSING THROUGH THE SLIDING DOORS and approachi Nicky's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fat Farhad sits in the back of the car as Nicky drives.

dialogues.speaker: FAT ASS FARHAD
dialogues.text: Is the chimichurri good? Love that shit.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I’ll take you for asado. I owe you one.

dialogues.speaker: FAT ASS FARHAD
dialogues.text: What’s with the coach seat?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Sorry, last minute.

dialogues.speaker: FAT ASS FARHAD
dialogues.text: Godamnned connection in Sao Paolo? Airport’s like JFK if it was in Mogadishu. Orange fucking tile gives me a headache.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I'll make it up to you.

dialogues.speaker: FAT ASS FARHAD
dialogues.text: Damn right. They had me squeezed between two fat guys. I swear we flew at a 45 degree angle the whole way down.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Are you done complaining? There’s a time issue.

dialogues.speaker: FAT ASS FARHAD
dialogues.text: Don’t question my professionalism. If I have a pulmonary embolism, let it hang on your head.  93.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I told you to get up and walk every hour. Did you get up and walk every hour?

dialogues.speaker: FAT ASS FARHAD
dialogues.text: Why? So I can stand in front of a bathroom door I can’t fit through? Me and the fat guys were pissing in Aquafina bottles like long haul truckers.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Sorry. Are you done?

dialogues.speaker: FAT ASS FARHAD
dialogues.text: You better have booked me a nice hotel too.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Motel.

dialogues.speaker: FAT ASS FARHAD
dialogues.text: Motel?!

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: It’s actually nice. I checked it out. Now are you done?

dialogues.speaker: FAT ASS FARHAD
dialogues.text: Yeah, just had to vent. (then) Where’s this going down? Nicky points to a GPS like device, tracking something.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Not sure yet. Mark is on the move. Public though.

dialogues.speaker: FAT ASS FARHAD
dialogues.text: You sure about this? This isn’t my speciality-

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Why are you still complaining? I’m giving you a cut-

dialogues.speaker: FAT ASS FARHAD
dialogues.text: I haven't heard from you in a year. And you haven't gigged in three from what I hear, so forgive me my impertinence.  94. Nicky isn’t going to argue anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A busy public square lined with shops, cafes, merchants, Nicky pulls in and parks. INT. NICKY’S CAR - DAY Nicky and Farhad scan the sea of crowded tables outside.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Back there- next to the guy in the yellow. (then) You got the piece?

dialogues.speaker: FAT ASS FARHAD
dialogues.text: In my bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farhad carries a small bag as he works his way through th crowded area. He negotiates his way past tables, eyeing passersby wearily. He turns his gaze ahead, locking in then palms the side pocket of his bag, checking for the mysterious contents. FARHAD POV: The crowd parts, revealing his mark at a tabl

dialogues.speaker: FAT ASS FARHAD
dialogues.text: Hey there. It’s JESS. She looks up to see him, pleasantly surprised.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Farhad!

dialogues.speaker: FAT ASS FARHAD
dialogues.text: Jess. She leaps to her feet and they hug.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Oh my god! You’ve lost so much weight! He looks exactly the same.  They do. 95.

dialogues.speaker: FAT ASS FARHAD
dialogues.text: I did a cleanse.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: You here with Nicky?

dialogues.speaker: FAT ASS FARHAD
dialogues.text: Sort of. Can I bend your ear?

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Sure, sit down...

dialogues.speaker: FAT ASS FARHAD
dialogues.text: You've got Nicky all nuts.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: I do? Good.

dialogues.speaker: FAT ASS FARHAD
dialogues.text: I’ve never seen him like this. You know he hasn’t worked since Miami?

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Seriously?

dialogues.speaker: FAT ASS FARHAD
dialogues.text: I know he’s an asshole. I mean, a really big asshole. But he’s my friend and I’m going to bat for him. Can’t you give the asshole a break?

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Okay, he flew you down here just to talk to me?

dialogues.speaker: FAT ASS FARHAD
dialogues.text: He knew you and me hit it off in Miami with me showing you pictures of my family and my dick and all.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Well yeah, that was special.

dialogues.speaker: FAT ASS FARHAD
dialogues.text: I don’t know- I think he thought that maybe you would listen to me being that we was so close.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: I don’t know what to say Farhad, it’s been a long time.  96.

dialogues.speaker: FAT ASS FARHAD
dialogues.text: He told me you got a thing going with this Spanish dude, what’s his face...

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Yeah well that’s where things get complex...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: ON NICKY, watching from the car, squinting at Farhad and through the crowd. They gab and eventually LAUGH uproariously.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO
dialogues.text: Farhad and Jess continue their conversation.

dialogues.speaker: FAT ASS FARHAD
dialogues.text: Nothing in life is easy you know?

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Listen- I know what he is. He may be obsessed with me now, but he’1l forget about me just like he did before.

dialogues.speaker: FAT ASS FARHAD
dialogues.text: I don’t think you’ve got that right. He seems different... and I’ve known him a long time.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Yeah? Farhad pulls a small box from his bag and hands it to her

dialogues.speaker: JESS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (opening it) What is it...? She lifts the lid to find the DECO STYLE GARNET NECKLACE coveted way back in Miami.

dialogues.speaker: FAT ASS FARHAD
dialogues.text: He kept it for you. All this time. Her eyes say it all.  97.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jess and Nicky walk along the blocks of brightly painted homes in the historical neighborhood. The mood is a bit awkward, but it’s a start.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: So I’m here. What’d you want to say to me?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: This feels like a job interview.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: I don’t have all day.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: So cold. You’ve changed.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: No. This isn’t how I treat people, it’s how I treat you.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: So you're saying I have a special place in your heart?

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: I don’t know about my heart. Something south of that. It might be pollups.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: You’re making this so easy.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: No problem. I can’t wait for the sucking sound of your empty platitudes.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: You are so mean. I hope you’re not a pet owner because you are definitely a kick the dog type.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: I have a lizard. You'd get along.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Again with the mean. Have pity. She stops him and makes eye contact.  98.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: You. Are. A dick. She turns and walks away. She stops.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I totally lost it, okay? Turns around.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Never happened to me before. Never. (stream of conscious) I was laying there that night and I couldn’t sleep and I was just looking at you and I was totally prepared to tell you anything. Whatever you wanted to hear. Everything. All my secrets...

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: That’s never happened to me. I- I - I had images of us, like... like...

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Like... together.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Like sexy stuff?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: No! Like normal stuff! Like camping at Yosemite. Driving to Big Sur. Eating crab at Fisherman's Wharf. It was all in California for some reason-- which is weird because I’ve only been there once when I was eight and I’m allergic to shellfish.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: I’m allergic to shellfish.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Really? See how well we’re hitting it off?  99.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Okay- we need to find someplace to sit ‘cause I think you’re having a meltdown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jess and Nicky sit at the edge of a QUAINT WHARF overlook a harbor at the edge of the neighborhood. Colorful tugs a fishing boats are moored nearby as Jess PUTS THE NECKLACE

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Looks nice. Jess accepts the compliment but changes the subject.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Farhad said you didn’t work for a long time...

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Couple years, yeah. Didn’t feel right. Actually started feeling bad about doing it... which is not something you want ina professional con artist. Empathy, a heart... what a disaster.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Yeah. God forbid.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Seriously. Not so much about the rich guys. But I think about some of the ones when I was little. My dad and I would run this scheme at these churches. I’d speak in tongues and he’d translate for a donation. What happened to those people? Or when I was 15, I rana credit card scam on this video store in Pennsylvania- back when they had the carbon paper slips? I drove back there last year and it’s not there. Video store was gone.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Don’t you think that was online streaming? Or Netflix or the big red thing at the grocery stores?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: What is that thing?  100.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Don’t tell me you blame yourself for Borders Books too.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: No. That was the Kindle.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Wow you really have become a wuss.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: It was a crisis of faith.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: All brought on by sleeping with me?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: RedBox! That’s the thing at the grocery store.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Did you just say that? Was that a naughty inference?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I think so.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Maybe you’re not such a wuss. Smiles. Then--

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I even reached out to my dad. Hadn't seen him in years. We buried a lot of our crap. Asked him if he’d ever gone straight. He was like, “I go straight every time I’m on parole.” He told me that you can’t live this life and then not live it. ‘Be a man and move on...’

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I’m working on it. Jess thinks a moment, reflecting.  101.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: You said this was no way to live. That I’d never be able to trust anyone. I didn’t believe you then, but I do now. I cut myself off.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: All brought on by sleeping with me?

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: I was headed that way anyway. It wasn't that big of a deal.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Was that a dig?

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Just a little one.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Clever.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Why’d you go to all this trouble Nicky. Absolution? Forgiveness? Piece of mind? What?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I can convince anyone of anything. One time I convinced a man that an empty warehouse with a single chair in it was the federal reserve. So I’m good. A good liar.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Yeah. You’re the best.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: But what I wanted to do was tell you the truth. To tell you the truth and to look into your eyes and... (inhales) I just need for you to believe me. They stare at one another. Nicky awaits her answer.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: I want to believe you Nicky. I really do. He’s disappointed.  102.

dialogues.speaker: JESS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I have to go. MUSIC. He watches as she walks away, late afternoon sun warmly reflecting off of her. She approaches a TAXI and gets in. Nicky turns his gaze t the sun setting on the harbor. It’s not long before Farhad ambles up behind him and rest sympathetic hand on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: FAT ASS FARHAD
dialogues.text: Let’s get something to eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sullen Nicky rides the elevator. It stops. A COUPLE boards. Down the hall an ELDERLY WOMAN makes her way towa the door. She looks up just as the door closes.

dialogues.speaker: ELDERLY WOMAN
dialogues.text: Por favor. Nicky put his arm out and holds the door. The woman enter ELDERLY WOMAN (CONT’D) Gracias.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: De nada.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator doors open. Nicky exits and makes his way ba to his room when he STOPS-- Jess sits at his door. She rises, she looks shaken, possi roughed up. He goes to her, quick to console.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: What happened? What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: I don’t want to talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Did he--

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Just kiss me.  103. He does. A loving kiss that’s been a long time in the mak They quickly lose themselves as he backs her to the door. Never breaking their embrace, Jess reaches into Nicky’s pocket and pulls out his room key. Blindly fumbling for t lock, Jess continues to kiss him as the door opens to rev a short HALLWAY leading to the bedroom. CAMERA FOLLOWS SLOWLY as Jess and Nicky stumble down the hallway, locked into each other, heading toward the BEDRO CAMERA MOVES IN SLOWLY as they land on the bed and contin

dialogues.speaker: MATCH DISSOLVE
dialogues.text: CAMERA CONTINUES to move in as DAYLIGHT fills the bedroom arrives at the bed to settle on the couple intertwined wi one another the NEXT MORNING. MUSICAL INTERLUDE as they look at one another, communicat only with long looks and smiles- each enjoying the other’ company without a word. It’s a simple and pure moment, not cloying or forced. Tot candid and unadorned, they are at once playful and loving Eventually Nicky’s face grows a touch more serious. There something he has to say. Then-

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I’m leaving soon. Conflict, concern play across Jess’ face but she says not

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come with me. She clearly wants to but doesn’t say. He grasps for a rea

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know you think you love him but I want you to come with me. Tonight.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Nicky... I don’t love him. But the thing is -

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: You can’t trust me. (then) I know and it probably serves me right. But I’ve changed and I know I can’t prove that but I’ve changed.  104.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Nicky there’s something -

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: He’s going to be at the track. Go get your stuff and come back here. I just have to finish my business and we’ll be gone. She sighs. Unsure where to begin. But before she can say- Nicky’s phone RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shit... (looks at phone) It’s Owens. I gotta take it. She grows concerned. He answers.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: OWENS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Just in my room.

dialogues.speaker: OWENS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Good. I’m at the door. Nicky hangs up, wincing.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: He’s here. Nicky gets up, grabs his pants as Jess puts on a nearby R ON NICKY, heading down the hall for the front door, passi DIVIDER WALL that separates the bed and bath section of t suite from the living area. He opens the door to reveal a suspicious Owens holding a SMALL PACKAGE. Nicky plays it cool.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey... Owens comes in uninvited. Nicky leads him to the living a

dialogues.speaker: OWENS
dialogues.text: Still sleeping? I thought you were meeting with McEwen...  105.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I’m on it. I have time.

dialogues.speaker: OWENS
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: OWENS
dialogues.text: There’s a lazy Sunday softness to your generation-- makes me uncomfortable. Owens wanders along the living area. It’s obvious he’s looking for something or someone.

dialogues.speaker: OWENS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I like to be on my feet. I'11 lay down when I get cancer. Or if I fuck. Both of which will be done on my back in case you were wondering. He heads for the OPEN FRENCH DOORS that lead to the BEDRO

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I’m glad you decided to share your life philosophy with me. I’m already seeing the world ina different light. Owens arrives at the FRENCH DOORS just as Jess is DUCKING the other BEDROOM DOOR, CLOSING IT as she goes.

dialogues.speaker: OWENS
dialogues.text: Sarcasm. Another pillar of your generation. You want to tell somebody to fuck off, tell ‘em to fuck off. Don’t say, ‘gee, what a great jacket.’ It’s weakness. Nicky rolls his eyes as Owens glances through to the bed.

dialogues.speaker: OWENS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s a messy bed.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I don’t sleep well. ON JESS, heading for the front door. BACK ON OWENS, entering the bedroom.  106.

dialogues.speaker: OWENS
dialogues.text: Someone here?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: No. Owens GRABS THE KNOB of the main bedroom door. ON JESS, trying to quietly open the front door when-- OWENS OPENS the bedroom door, forcing her to duck into th living room.

dialogues.speaker: OWENS
dialogues.text: You know why you don’t sleep well? Added complexity to the point of distraction. He closes the door behind him and wanders down the hallwa that leads to the front door. JESS is on the other side o the dividing wall in the living area, matching his pace.

dialogues.speaker: OWENS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All of you with your phones and computers that bring nothing but a barrage of useless information. Nicky gets in front of him, hoping to lead him to the doo and facilitate his exit-- not noticing Owens grabbing a S TRASH CAN and setting a trap for Jess by putting it in fr of the bedroom door.

dialogues.speaker: OWENS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fucking Twitter? Like anyone really cares that you’re eating a turkey sandwich for lunch. (realizing) Sorry... ‘Panini.’

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Sarcasm?

dialogues.speaker: OWENS
dialogues.text: Satire.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Are you here for a reason?

dialogues.speaker: OWENS
dialogues.text: Who'd you pick up at the airport? ON JESS, on the other side of the dividing wall. She catc sight of the trap Owens laid- she can’t go through the bedroom again.  107. Nicky arrives at the door first, glancing back at the liv area and CATCHES A GLIMPSE of Jess SLIPPING ONTO THE BALC

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Garriga has you following me?

dialogues.speaker: OWENS
dialogues.text: I got people there.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: He’s my computer guy. Owens blows past him and re-enters the living area.

dialogues.speaker: OWENS
dialogues.text: Why? Is there a problem?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: There won’t be. Because he came.

dialogues.speaker: OWENS
dialogues.text: I got a little red hair on my taint that tickles when something's afoot. Lately I’ve been scratching my nethers like a fucking Macaque. He wanders toward the balcony. Nicky follows.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Look. Nothing’s going on. Everything’s on schedule. We’re wrapping up. No one should get spooked just because we’re near the end. This stops Owens for a moment- just short of the balcony. turns. He sizes Nicky up. Nicky gestures to the front doo

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now come on. Let me do my job. Owens stares him down. And just when it seems he’s satisf He turns and walks onto the balcony. Nicky cringes, following him out to find--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOTHING. Jess isn’t there, only Owens. He stares out at t grounds resolutely.

dialogues.speaker: OWENS
dialogues.text: Nice day.  108. He goes back inside, leaving Nicky looking around for Jes He looks to the NEXT BALCONY. The gap is impossibly wide, JESS POKES HER HEAD UP. Somehow she made the jump and, fr the look of her it was terrifying. She’s rattled to the b He mouths, ‘You okay?’ She manages a nod. He pulls his RO KEY from his pocket and tosses it to her. She catches it. He pantomimes, “Meet here. 7 O’clock...” then heads insid INT. BUENOS AIRES HOTEL - NICKY’S ROOM -— CONTINUOUS Nicky enters to find Owens placing the small package on t table and LOOKING AT HIS WATCH--

dialogues.speaker: OWENS
dialogues.text: Call us when you finish with McEwen.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Will you stop worrying? I’m on my way. EXT. MCEWEN TEST TRACK — DAY In the pit, Nicky, McEwen and the Tech sit before monitor that display the Garriga information. McEwen smiles broad and slaps him on the back.

dialogues.speaker: TECH
dialogues.text: Incredible...

dialogues.speaker: MCEWEN
dialogues.text: You're my favorite person. I swear you're six inches taller and twice as handsome as when you walked in here. Gordon the bodyguard approaches on McEwen’s signal and pl a bag of cash in front of Nicky. He shakes with McEwen.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: It’s been a pleasure, Mr. McEwen. I wish you the best of luck.

dialogues.speaker: MCEWEN
dialogues.text: With friends like you, who needs luck? McEwen and his men laugh at his joke. Nicky joins in.  109.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC as Nicky drives his rental car with 3 million dolla in a bag at his side. He dials his cell, awaits an answer

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: (into phone) Mr. Garriga? It’s done. I wish you the best of luck.

dialogues.speaker: GARRIGA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: With friends like you? Who needs luck? Nicky smiles as Garriga LAUGHS. He hangs up and speeds do the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC CONTINUES as Nicky pulls into a high end industrial park arriving at the open garages of the LOTUS RACING TEA He’s greeted by the LOTUS HEAD ENGINEER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicky, the Head Lotus Engineer and a Lotus Tech sit befor monitors that display the Garriga information. The Engine smiles broadly and slaps him on the back.

dialogues.speaker: LOTUS ENGINEER
dialogues.text: Worth every penny. A bag of cash is placed in front of Nicky. He shakes hand with the Engineer.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: It’s been a pleasure, Mr. Gallagher. I wish you the best of luck.

dialogues.speaker: LOTUS ENGINEER
dialogues.text: With friends like you, who needs luck? The Lotus guys laugh at his joke. Nicky joins in.  110.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC CONTINUES as Nicky drives his rental car with 6 mil dollars in the TWO BAGS at his side. He speeds down the r with a satisfied grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicky, the Head RENAULT ENGINEER and a RENAULT TECH sit before monitors that display the Garriga information.

dialogues.speaker: RENAULT ENGINEER
dialogues.text: C’est magnifique! A bag of cash is placed in front of Nicky. He shakes hand with the Engineer.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: It’s been a pleasure, Monsieur. I wish you the best of luck.

dialogues.speaker: RENAULT ENGINEER
dialogues.text: With friends like you, who needs luck? The Renault guys laugh at his joke. Nicky joins in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man in a FERRARI JACKET slides a bag of money to Nicky.

dialogues.speaker: FERRARI ENGINEER
dialogues.text: With friends like you, who needs luck? They both LAUGH at his joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicky LAUGHS with the HRT TEAM OWNER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicky LAUGHS with the HEAD OF TEAM INDIA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicky LAUGHS with the HEAD OF TEAM MARUSSIA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicky stuffs money into a duffel bag in his trunk, zips i closed and SLAMS THE TRUNK SHUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DING. The elevator doors open and Nicky emerges with TWO FULL DUFFEL BAGS, headed for his suite. INT. BUENOS AIRES HOTEL - NICKY’S ROOM - NIGHT Nicky enters his suite and as the door shuts behind him--

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Hello? No response. He walks into the living area.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jess? He looks at his WATCH: 7:05. He continues on to the bedroom. No sign of her. He’s concerned. Anxious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. NICKY’S SUITE - LATER THAT NIGHT Nicky is seated on the bed, waiting. Still anxious. He glances at his watch: 7:30. This time it’s him who’s b left alone. Nicky chokes back his emotions and refocuses. He marches the front foyer, grabs the bags and opens the door to rev JESS, luggage in hand, ready to go.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Sorry I’m late. He’s relieved, but doesn't speak.  112.

dialogues.speaker: JESS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What...? A smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON hulking GORDON, McEwen’s bodyguard, squinting, looking for something, getting frustrated. REVEAL he’s staring at a shelf of medical supplies. Final he finds what he’s looking for. A NIGHT GUARD mouthpiece.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: AT THE REGISTER, the CHECKOUT GIRL tallies up his items:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon enjoys a small meal at the bar, watching futbol on TV and drinking a cerveza.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: Gooo00000000000000a11111111! The bar patrons explode with joy, but not Gordon.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: Fucking twats... BEEP. His cellphone gets a text. He reads it, then matter of factly motions for his check.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Cuenta... And as he shovels down a few more bites--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon exits the bar and heads for his SUV. He notices a in his bumper.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: Ah bloody hell... He’s pissed, looking for a culprit. Then, a beat later, h LAUGHS to himself- as if hearing a joke in his head.  113. He disregards the dent, gets in the vehicle and drives aw INT. GORDON’S CAR - NIGHT Gordon drives on a HIGHWAY, tuning in the game on the rad BEEP. Another TEXT. He reads it out of the corner of his He continues to drive a bit, then puts on his blinker and EXITS AN OFF RAMP. INT. GORDON’S CAR - LATER THAT NIGHT Gordon drives down a city street, looking for street sign Eventually he makes a turn and digs through the shopping next to him until he pulls out the NIGHT GUARD he purchas He tries to open the packaging with great difficulty, fin tearing it apart with his teeth. He PUTS THE MOUTHPIECE I Still driving, LOUDLY BREATHING through the hole in the mouthpiece. He reaches back into the bag for the NECK BRA HE PUTS IT ON, turns up the game on the radio and SLAMS H FOOT ON THE PEDAL. VROOM! Within moments he’s moving at INCREDIBLE SPEED dow the city street. CAMERA HOLDS ON GORDON as the car gets faster and faster, noise of the engine and the game BUILDING IN VOLUME until CRASH! The windows SHATTER, the AIRBAG EXPLODES-- absorbi Gordon’s mass as best it can. He stunned for a moment but soon shakes it off. He opens door and, removing his neckbrace--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon exits the car, shedding the neckbrace. He pulls a PISTOL from inside his jacket and spits out th night guard just as he arrives at the CAR he just hit to JESS AND NICKY, bloodied and disoriented in Nicky’s car. They're alive enough to see a gun is pointed right at the CUT TO BLACK. A few ominous beats of darkness.  114. SLOW, REVERBERANT FOOTSTEPS are heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON expensive OXFORDS walking across the cold concre of a dimly lit INDUSTRIAL SPACE-- passing tools and equip and eventually revealing a disturbing TABLEAU-- Jess and Nicky, BOUND and GAGGED with tape, seated on CHA Gordon sits watch nearby, tending to his own small wounds with the rubbing alcohol and gauze he bought while holdin them at GUNPOINT. The TWO DUFFELS OF CASH are opened in front of them. They all look to the newly arrived man who stops before t

dialogues.speaker: GARRIGA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Remove the tape from his mouth. REVEAL Garriga looking on them with disdain. Owens is a f steps behind him, settling in as Gordon removes the tape, from Nicky. Jess is left gagged. She’s scared. GARRIGA (CONT’D) Do you really think I’m such an amateur that I would not have someone on the inside with McEwen? Someone to keep eyes on you? (then) Twenty years in this business teach you never to be too careful. He’s my secret weapon... (then) Now imagine my surprise when Gordon showed me what you sold to McEwen. Not some fake software as we discussed. But my plans, my designs, (explodes )

dialogues.speaker: SERVERS
dialogues.text: (then) What’s more- You sold it to McEwen for three million dollars. But in these bags there is 27 million dollars which means YOU SOLD IT TO

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE
dialogues.text: His anger ECHOES through the facility.  115.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: You hired a con man. THWACK! Owens punches Nicky’s insolent mouth.

dialogues.speaker: OWENS
dialogues.text: Theiving piece of shite. Garriga gets a tenuous hold on his rage.

dialogues.speaker: GARRIGA
dialogues.text: So- before the inevitable bloody end, I want to know how. How did you get the information? He DARTS TOWARD JESS in a rage.

dialogues.speaker: IT
dialogues.text: He GRABS HER by the throat with one hand, PINCHING HER NO with the other.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: No no-- Nicky is powerless as Jess struggles for air.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Stop! I'll tell you! She had nothing to do with it! I/’11 tell you! He lets go, turns his glare on Nicky.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She's totally innocent. I have a guy- he cracked your encryption, found a backdoor into your servers, it was easy. You should really fire your I.T. guy by the way... This angers Garriga.  116.

dialogues.speaker: GARRIGA
dialogues.text: No. You used my login, my password. How did you get it?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: It’s easy. Just brute force. Computer tries all possible combinations. Infinite monkeys, infinite typewriters-—

dialogues.speaker: GARRIGA
dialogues.text: Bullshit! Liar! Garriga whips out a key fob SECURITY KEY (A real device f high end cybersecurity that randomly generates passwords its small display). GARRIGA (CONT’D) This generates a new password every 15 minutes and it never leaves my sight. How did you get it?!

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: What’s it matter? It’s done.

dialogues.speaker: GARRIGA
dialogues.text: Tell me! He pinches Jess’ nose again. Gordon cocks his pistol.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Leave her alone!

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Let go!

dialogues.speaker: ALL RIGHT FINE IT WAS HER
dialogues.text: Garriga backs off. Jess is shocked, she looks to Nicky.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But she didn’t know it. She didn’t know anything. Jess tries to speak, shocked. Garriga is intrigued.  117.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your security is tight- tighter than I expected. QUICK FLASH: Nicky in his room, trying to hack into Garriga’s servers with great difficulty.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I thought I could break the key, but I couldn’t. I was ready to give up- but when I saw Jess at the party- QUICK FLASH: Nicky and Jess talking at the party.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: --once I knew you were together, I had something to work with. Jess, still bound, looks on with disbelief. She shakes he head, trying to speak as Nicky’s eyes go cold.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (cold) I used her. I’ve been using her. He looks at Jess’ pained face, he has no sympathy for her

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There’s a science to winning someone over. For a woman it’s all about emotion. Connection. QUICK FLASH: Nicky and Jess at the pool bar.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You have to make them believe you feel emotion as strongly as they do... It’s what they’ve been waiting for all their lives... QUICK FLASH: At the pool bar, Nicky talks about Miami.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Shared history was my in. After that you open her up. QUICK FLASH: Farhad greeting Jess.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: A friendly face sets her off balance, defuses aggression. You talk about emotional matters.  118. QUICK FLASH: Nicky pouring his heart out to Jess.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Body language- arms down, you’re exposed. They pick up on it. And once you get them talking, you move into their personal space- not from the front, that’s aggression-- but from the side. QUICK FLASH of Nicky and Jess talking in the Boca neighborhood while he slides in next to her.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sociologists call it the Gauchais Reaction. They’re disarmed. (then) Now they’re open. You know you’re there once they start to mimic you unconsciously. A head bob, a hand movement. It means you’re in sync. Then you seal the deal. Tell her she’s changed you. Changed how you see the world. And then you close... FLASHBACK TO THE WATERFRONT as Jess puts the NECKLACE on.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Give her a talisman, a symbol, or in this case, a gift that says ‘you were always in my thoughts...’

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: ON JESS, tied up, crying as Nicky keeps explaining.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There was a wireless keylogger in the necklace. QUICK FLASH: Jess returns to the suite with the necklace and hides it in her drawer.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All she had to do was bring it back to the room... QUICK FLASH: Garriga works on his iPad in his room, he glances at the display on his security key and starts typ in a password with his WIRELESS KEYBOARD.  119.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...It picked up the keystrokes and I got it all. QUICK FLASH: Nicky sits at his laptop in his room, RECEIV THE DATA on his laptop as JESS SLEEPS IN THE BACKGROUND.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Then I logged into your server as you and downloaded everything I could find about the EXR... And as he LOGS INTO GARRIGA’S SERVER--

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Garriga stares at Nicky, absorbing this. Jess closes her teary eyes, devastated.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: It’s not her fault. She had no idea. She got fooled, but she’s not to blame. Just let her go. He looks to teary Jess.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. She shakes her head. Garriga thinks. He looks to Owens. A beat, then-- He starts LAUGHING. Nicky is confused. Owens LAUGHS too.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What? What’s so funny?

dialogues.speaker: GARRIGA
dialogues.text: I think he’s lost his mind! Laughing continues. Gordon seems perplexed. He laughs any

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: What? Unable to talk, Garriga motions for Owens to pull off the tape from Jess’ mouth.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What? Owens removes the tape. Jess looks to Nicky.  120.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Oh my God you really do love me. Nicky is flummoxed.

dialogues.speaker: JESS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We’re so screwed.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?!

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Garriga’s not my boyfriend. I hardly even know him. ON NICKY, absolutely blindsided.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: What!?

dialogues.speaker: GARRIGA
dialogues.text: What the hell were you saying about me and her? She’s just a race skank!

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Race skank!? What is that?! Nicky can’t believe his ears.

dialogues.speaker: GARRIGA
dialogues.text: She's been driving me crazy, hanging around, flirting, teasing-- and the minute I try to get her up to my room? A headache, a period. The world’s longest period. She’s never even been in my room.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Jess? What the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: I was just trying to make you jealous.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: You did! I saw you in his room.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: It was a hooker. I sent her up to his room.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: That’s not true.  121.

dialogues.speaker: GARRIGA
dialogues.text: It’s true, I use prostitutas.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: (to Jess) I saw your face!

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: You saw what I wanted you to see. You taught me that, remember.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: You are a race skank.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: I am not a race skank!

dialogues.speaker: GARRIGA
dialogues.text: Not a very good one at least.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Then what the hell were you doing with him?!

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: I was trying to steal his watch. I was on him for a week, waiting for my chance and then you showed up. Garriga holds up his wrist, displaying a gorgeous timepie

dialogues.speaker: GARRIGA
dialogues.text: This watch?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: (to Jess) You're still doing watches?

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: It’s a Richard Mille! It’s worth 500,000 dollars!

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: You’re so much better than watches!

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: I’m good at it- It’s what I like!

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: But he roughed you up!

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: He didn’t, he did.  122. Jess motions to Owens. Nicky glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: OWENS
dialogues.text: She was stealing from him.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: He caught me racking up charges on Garriga’s credit line. He scared the shit out of me.

dialogues.speaker: GARRIGA
dialogues.text: (to Owens) This is unbelievable...

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: (to Jess) Just to make me jealous? Were you ever gonna tell me?

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: I tried to!

dialogues.speaker: GARRIGA
dialogues.text: Enough.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Like a killer whale playing with a baby seal...

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Oh that’s rich! Like you’re the great communicator!

dialogues.speaker: GARRIGA
dialogues.text: Quiet!

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: What was I supposed to say? “I’m ripping off your boyfriend please don’t tell him?”

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Oh that’s a convenient excuse!

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: It makes perfect sense! If it was a lie, it was a white lie!

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I care about you! I was worried about you!  123.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: You were worried about a duffle bag full of cash is what you were worried about!

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: How can you say that? I just tried to save your life!

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: By lying! Like you always do! Black lies!

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
