dialogues.text: We're both liars! That’s why we're together! And if it wasn’t a white lie then it was a grey one! A light grey one-- BANG! Owens SHOOTS NICKY IN THE CHEST, flipping him backw in his chair. Jess SCREAMS as he lands on the floor, gasping. We’re instantly back to a harsh reality.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Nicky!! Garriga is as shocked as anyone.

dialogues.speaker: GARRIGA
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you doing?! Jess continues to SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: OWENS
dialogues.text: I couldn't take another fucking word. STAY ON JESS as she watches Nicky struggle to stay alive, Garriga and Owens argue in the background.

dialogues.speaker: GARRIGA
dialogues.text: Control yourself with that cannon! It will bring the police!! Nicky is fading quickly. Jess throws herself off the chai landing on her knees, fighting her bonds to get to Nicky.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Nicky Nicky Nicky- look at me... He’s writhing and gasping and delirious.  124.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Toledo...? Is it Toledo...?

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: What? Nicky it’s me. Nicky is quickly lost in a haze of pain and lack of air. Owens holds the gun to Jess’ head. She’s too preoccupied dying Nicky to care.

dialogues.speaker: OWENS
dialogues.text: What about her? Garriga thinks. He steps up to her.

dialogues.speaker: GARRIGA
dialogues.text: Look at me. She ignores him, staring at dying Nicky. Garriga grabs her chin, turning her head to him. She glar at him-- Then SWINGS AT HIM WILDLY with her bound hands. He bats o her attack easily, quickly gaining control. She burns with hatred and despair. GARRIGA (CONT’D) Lo siento quierda... He lets go. Headed for the door- motioning for Gordon to follow him out. GARRIGA (CONT’D) (to Owens) Kill her. Just do it quietly. Garriga and Gordon EXIT as Jess returns her attention to Nicky, who is slipping away fast.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Look at me look at me-- look at me. Glassy eyed, Nicky barely manages to focus on her voice.

dialogues.speaker: JESS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I love you. I love you. Look at my eyes. I believe you. I believe you. I love you. I trust you. A long moment and-- he’s gone.  125. She collapses on him, devastated. And as she cries, the sound of OWENS rummaging through METAL DRAWERS AND CABINE is heard. She glances over to see OWENS-- collecting a strange assortment of FRIGHTENING IMPLEMENTS AND DUCT TAPE from t workshop shelves into a tool tray. Jess could not care less, the quicker the better. And as heads over to her, she steals one more longing look at Ni Something catches her eye beside his head. A metal PEN fr Nicky’s pocket. An idea as Owens approaches ominously behind her. She reaches for it with her bound hands. And as he comes to a stop behind her-- SHE SWINGS AROUND and STABS him in the leg.

dialogues.speaker: AHHH
dialogues.text: He drops the tray, showering Jess with the sharp metal objects as he falls to his knees in pain.

dialogues.speaker: OWENS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the fuck! He backhands her in a rage-- swatting her away. He pulls the pen and grumbles through gritted teeth.

dialogues.speaker: OWENS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you want him to fucking die?! Jess is flummoxed by his words-- WHICH ARE SUDDENLY SPOKE AN AMERICAN ACCENT. His Welsh accent is GONE.

dialogues.speaker: OWENS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t you know anything? Owens rummages through the tools on the ground-- finding OIL INJECTOR (basically a large SYRINGE) and turning his attention to Nicky’s wound--

dialogues.speaker: OWENS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What kind of piker are you? You never heard of a Toledo Panic Button? Didn’t he tell you I was inside? Jess is absolutely speechless. She can only shake her hea  126.

dialogues.speaker: OWENS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus- you must be terrified. Must’ve shaved a decade off your life with panic... He flips Nicky on his side, rips open his shirt around th exit wound. He tears off some DUCT TAPE and covers the ho

dialogues.speaker: OWENS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You shoot between the third and fourth rib. About eleven O’clock of the left nipple. It misses the heart, all the major arteries. Just punctures the lung. Works most of the time. Well, fifty five percent of the time. Probabilistic. He flips Nicky on his back and tapes shut the entry wound

dialogues.speaker: OWENS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Untreated, you’ve got ten minutes tops before he drowns in his own blood. He STICKS the blunt injector needle through the tape and DRAWS BACK the PLUNGER. It fills with BLOOD.

dialogues.speaker: OWENS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But patch it up and account for the cavity pressure... He PULLS THE PLUNGER OUT completely and-- SPLRT-WHOOOOSH. The blood clears as air rushes out of Nicky’s chest cavity.

dialogues.speaker: OWENS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: +..you got about two hours to get to a hospital. GASP. With a thunderous rush, Nicky DRAWS A MAMMOTH BREAT filling his lungs with blessed air. Jess fills with hope.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Nicky! Owens beams.

dialogues.speaker: OWENS
dialogues.text: There’s my boy.... there we go.  127. Owens replaces the plunger in the syringe, equalizing the pressure. As Nicky takes a few more breaths, Owens quickl cuts Jess loose.

dialogues.speaker: OWENS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Keep an eye on that. Pull the plunger if he can’t breathe. She scrambles to Nicky, scooping him into her arms. He’s no means in good shape, but he’s alive.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: You're alive... you’re alive... Nicky manages his first pained words.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Fuck you Dad! Jess can’t believe her ears.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: OWENS
dialogues.text: (to Nicky) Language boy- I just saved your life!

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: You couldn’t have shot them instead?

dialogues.speaker: OWENS
dialogues.text: And have the whole world rain down on my head? This was your mess! You pay for it. Three years I was on the inside! For what? So you could blow it to make cow eyes with some race skank?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY JESS
dialogues.text: She is NOT a race skank!! I am NOT a race skank!!

dialogues.speaker: OWENS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I brought you in. You said you could handle it. I should have known with all your talk of regret and ennui that you were gimped. Live and learn I say. He extends a hand to Jess with a big smile.  128.

dialogues.speaker: OWENS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m Bucky by the way. She shakes.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: OWENS
dialogues.text: I like you. You can take a punch.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Thanks. A moment of calm. Owens looks at the nearby duffels.

dialogues.speaker: OWENS
dialogues.text: Well there it is, the ill gotten gain... (then) We gotta get him to the hospital before that other lung fills up with blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owens drives as Jess tends to Nicky in the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: OWENS
dialogues.text: I’ve been working for this prick Spaniard for three years. He’s got a guy at McEwen and he doesn’t tell me? What the hell happened to trust? (self-scolding) Should have seen it. Sloppy. You can be many things in this game but sloppy ain’t one of them. Time to get out.

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: It was a hell of con though. Sorry we messed it up.

dialogues.speaker: OWENS
dialogues.text: Beaut wasn’t it? (then) You know what the hard part was? The hard part wasn’t getting him to hire a con man. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: OWENS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No, no- the hard part was getting him to think it was his idea to hire a con man. Ah, fuck it-- the hard part was not laughing. Too rich. (then) You can’t con an honest man. Ever heard that? They gotta have larceny in their heart. Isn’t that right Nicholas? Nicky, bleary, nods.

dialogues.speaker: OWENS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Larceny in their heart. This guy’s heart was black with the stuff. Low hanging fruit. He pulls over, parking across the street from a HOSPITAL. glances in the mirror at Jess and Nicky, happy together.

dialogues.speaker: OWENS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This life is no place for lovebirds. There’s no happiness here with that. Just think about this honey-- you tricked my boy. That’s no small feat. But the con you pulled wasn’t for money. It was for love. Now you got me choked up. But this game is about the money and if you’re not into that you need to move to the land of the regular people. Where trust isn’t a tool to get you rich or get you laid... it’s where trust is everything. (beat) It’s all you got and all you’1ll ever have. And like it or not, that’s who you are now. Both of you. Another glance in rear view. They seem okay with his assessment. It softens him a touch.

dialogues.speaker: OWENS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But look at you two. In love. It’s a beautiful thing. (he turns to them) But I’m taking the money. All of it. Nicky doesn’t seem surprised as Owens gets out of the car pops the trunk.  130.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: That’s Dad...

dialogues.speaker: JESS
dialogues.text: Well that explains you... Nicky smiles. KNOCK KNOCK. Owens raps on the window. Jess rolls it down to reveal his curmudegeonly face.

dialogues.speaker: OWENS
dialogues.text: I‘1l see you at Christmas. He walks off with the two duffle bags of cash and disappe into the gloam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC as Jess shoulders Nicky’s weight as they walk acros the street. As they shuffle along, they seem strangely happy. Well suited, content. They head to the hospital. They head for the future. In l A GLINT catches Nicky’s eye. He looks to Jess’ wrist: It's Garriga’s watch. FADE OUT.
